Hebrew: וּבִשְׁנַ֣ת אַחַ֗ת לְכ֙וֹרֶשׁ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ פָּרַ֔ס לִכְל֥וֹת דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה מִפִּ֣י יִרְמְיָ֑ה הֵעִ֣יר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־ר֙וּחַ֙ כֹּ֣רֶשׁ מֶֽלֶךְ־פָּרַ֔ס וַיַּֽעֲבֶר־קוֹל֙ בְּכׇל־מַלְכוּת֔וֹ וְגַם־בְּמִכְתָּ֖ב לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the first year of King Cyrus of Persia, when the word of the L<small>ORD</small> spoken by Jeremiah was fulfilled, the L<small>ORD</small> roused the spirit of King Cyrus of Persia to issue a proclamation throughout his realm by word of mouth and in writing as follows:
Transliteration: uvishenat achat lekhvoresh melekhe faras likhelvot devar-yehovah mifiy yiremeyah heiyr yehovah et-rucha khoresh melekhe-faras vayaaver-kvol vekhׇl-malekhutvo vegam-vemikhetav lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה אָמַ֗ר כֹּ֚רֶשׁ מֶ֣לֶךְ פָּרַ֔ס כֹּ֚ל מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ נָ֣תַן לִ֔י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְהֽוּא־פָקַ֤ד עָלַי֙ לִבְנֽוֹת־ל֣וֹ בַ֔יִת בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּֽיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: “Thus said King Cyrus of Persia: The L<small>ORD</small> God of Heaven has given me all the kingdoms of the earth and has charged me with building Him a house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah.
Transliteration: khoh amar khoresh melekhe faras khol mamelekhvot haarets natan liy yehovah elohey hashamayiim vehu-fakad alay livenvot-lvo vayiit viyrushala͏im asher viyhudah

Hebrew: מִֽי־בָכֶ֣ם מִכׇּל־עַמּ֗וֹ יְהִ֤י אֱלֹהָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וְיַ֕עַל לִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּיהוּדָ֑ה וְיִ֗בֶן אֶת־בֵּ֤ית יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל ה֥וּא הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Anyone of you of all His people—may his God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem that is in Judah and build the House of the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel, the God that is in Jerusalem;
Transliteration: miy-vakhem mikhׇl-amvo yehiy elohayv imvo veyaal liyrushala͏im asher viyhudah veyiven et-veyt yehovah elohey yisherael hu haElohim asher viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַנִּשְׁאָ֗ר מִֽכׇּל־הַמְּקֹמוֹת֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ה֣וּא גָֽר־שָׁם֒ יְנַשְּׂא֙וּהוּ֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י מְקֹמ֔וֹ בְּכֶ֥סֶף וּבְזָהָ֖ב וּבִרְכ֣וּשׁ וּבִבְהֵמָ֑ה עִ֨ם־הַנְּדָבָ֔ה לְבֵ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: and all who stay behind, wherever he may be living, let the people of his place assist him with silver, gold, goods, and livestock, besides the freewill offering to the House of God that is in Jerusalem.”
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hanishear mikhׇl-hamekomvot asher hu gar-sham yenasheuhu aneshey mekomvo vekhesef uvezahav uvirekhush uvivehemah im-hanedavah leveyt haElohim asher viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיָּק֜וּמוּ רָאשֵׁ֣י הָאָב֗וֹת לִֽיהוּדָה֙ וּבִנְיָמִ֔ן וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֑ם לְכֹ֨ל הֵעִ֤יר הָאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־רוּח֔וֹ לַעֲל֣וֹת לִבְנ֔וֹת אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: So the chiefs of the clans of Judah and Benjamin, and the priests and Levites, all whose spirit had been roused by God, got ready to go up to build the House of the L<small>ORD</small> that is in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayakumu rashey haavvot liyhudah uvineyamin vehakhohaniym vehaleviyim lekhol heiyr haElohim et-ruchvo laalvot livenvot et-veyt yehovah asher viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וְכׇל־סְבִיבֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ חִזְּק֣וּ בִֽידֵיהֶ֔ם בִּכְלֵי־כֶ֧סֶף בַּזָּהָ֛ב בָּרְכ֥וּשׁ וּבַבְּהֵמָ֖ה וּבַמִּגְדָּנ֑וֹת לְבַ֖ד עַל־כׇּל־הִתְנַדֵּֽב׃ {פ}
Translated: All their neighbors supported them with silver vessels, with gold, with goods, with livestock, and with precious objects, besides what had been given as a freewill offering.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-seviyvoteyhem chizeku viydeyhem vikheley-khesef vazahav varekhush uvavehemah uvamigedanvot levad al-khׇl-hitenadev {f}

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֣לֶךְ כּ֔וֹרֶשׁ הוֹצִ֖יא אֶת־כְּלֵ֣י בֵית־יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצִ֤יא נְבֽוּכַדְנֶצַּר֙ מִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖ם בְּבֵ֥ית אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated: King Cyrus released the vessels of the L<small>ORD</small>’s house which Nebuchadnezzar had taken away from Jerusalem and had put in the house of his god.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe khvoresh hvotsiy et-kheley veyt-yehovah asher hvotsiy nevukhadenetsar miyrushala͏im vayitenem veveyt elohayv

Hebrew: וַיּֽוֹצִיאֵ֗ם כּ֚וֹרֶשׁ מֶ֣לֶךְ פָּרַ֔ס עַל־יַ֖ד מִתְרְדָ֣ת הַגִּזְבָּ֑ר וַֽיִּסְפְּרֵם֙ לְשֵׁשְׁבַּצַּ֔ר הַנָּשִׂ֖יא לִיהוּדָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: These King Cyrus of Persia released through the office of Mithredath the treasurer, who gave an inventory of them to Sheshbazzar the prince of Judah.
Transliteration: vayyvotsiyem khvoresh melekhe faras al-yad miteredat hagizevar vayiseferem lesheshevatsar hanashiy liyhudah {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה מִסְפָּרָ֑ם אֲגַרְטְלֵ֨י זָהָ֜ב שְׁלֹשִׁ֗ים אֲגַרְטְלֵי־כֶ֙סֶף֙ אָ֔לֶף מַחֲלָפִ֖ים תִּשְׁעָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: This is the inventory: 30 gold basins, 1,000 silver basins, 29 knives,
Transliteration: veeleh misefaram agareteley zahav sheloshiym agareteley-khesef alef machalafiym tisheah veesheriym {s}

Hebrew: כְּפוֹרֵ֤י זָהָב֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֔ים כְּפ֤וֹרֵי כֶ֙סֶף֙ מִשְׁנִ֔ים אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וַעֲשָׂרָ֑ה כֵּלִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: 30 gold bowls, 410 silver double bowls, 1,000 other vessels;
Transliteration: khefvorey zahav sheloshiym khefvorey khesef misheniym areva mevot vaasharah kheliym acheriym alef

Hebrew: כׇּל־כֵּלִים֙ לַזָּהָ֣ב וְלַכֶּ֔סֶף חֲמֵ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים וְאַרְבַּ֣ע מֵא֑וֹת הַכֹּ֞ל הֶעֱלָ֣ה שֵׁשְׁבַּצַּ֗ר עִ֚ם הֵעָל֣וֹת הַגּוֹלָ֔ה מִבָּבֶ֖ל לִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated: in all, 5,400 gold and silver vessels. Sheshbazzar brought all these back when the exiles came back from Babylon to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khׇl-kheliym lazahav velakhesef chameshet alafiym veareva mevot hakhol heelah sheshevatsar im healvot hagvolah mivavel liyrushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣לֶּה ׀ בְּנֵ֣י הַמְּדִינָ֗ה הָֽעֹלִים֙ מִשְּׁבִ֣י הַגּוֹלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶגְלָ֛ה (נבוכדנצור) [נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּ֥ר] מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל לְבָבֶ֑ל וַיָּשׁ֛וּבוּ לִירוּשָׁלַ֥͏ִם וִֽיהוּדָ֖ה אִ֥ישׁ לְעִירֽוֹ׃
Translated: These are the people of the province who came up from among the captive exiles whom King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon had carried into exile to Babylon, who returned to Jerusalem and Judah, each to his own city,
Transliteration: veeleh veney hamediynah haoliym misheviy hagvolah asher hegelah (nvvkhdntsvr) [nevukhadenetsar] melekhe-vavel levavel vayashuvu liyrushala͏im viyhudah iysh leiyrvo

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣אוּ עִם־זְרֻבָּבֶ֗ל יֵשׁ֡וּעַ נְ֠חֶמְיָ֠ה שְׂרָיָ֨ה רְֽעֵלָיָ֜ה מׇרְדֳּכַ֥י בִּלְשָׁ֛ן מִסְפָּ֥ר בִּגְוַ֖י רְח֣וּם בַּעֲנָ֑ה מִסְפַּ֕ר אַנְשֵׁ֖י עַ֥ם יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, Baanah:
The list of the men of the people of Israel:
Transliteration: asher-vau im-zeruvavel eishua nechemeyah sherayah reelayah mׇredokhay vileshan misefar vigevay rechum vaanah misefar aneshey am yisherael {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔שׁ אַלְפַּ֕יִם מֵאָ֖ה שִׁבְעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Parosh—2,172;
Transliteration: veney fareosh alefayiim meah shiveiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י שְׁפַטְיָ֔ה שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שִׁבְעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Shephatiah—372;
Transliteration: veney shefateyah shelosh mevot shiveiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י אָרַ֔ח שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת חֲמִשָּׁ֥ה וְשִׁבְעִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Arah—775;
Transliteration: veney arach sheva mevot chamishah veshiveiym {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵֽי־פַחַ֥ת מוֹאָ֛ב לִבְנֵ֥י יֵשׁ֖וּעַ יוֹאָ֑ב אַלְפַּ֕יִם שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Pahath-moab: the sons of Jeshua and Joab—2,812;
Transliteration: veney-fachat mvoav liveney eishua yvoav alefayiim shemoneh mevot usheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י עֵילָ֔ם אֶ֕לֶף מָאתַ֖יִם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Elam—1,254;
Transliteration: veney eylam elef matayiim chamishiym vearevaah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י זַתּ֔וּא תְּשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Zattu—945;
Transliteration: veney zatu tesha mevot vearevaiym vachamishah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י זַכָּ֔י שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וְשִׁשִּֽׁים׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Zaccai—760;
Transliteration: veney zakhay sheva mevot veshishiym {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בָנִ֔י שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bani—642;
Transliteration: veney vaniy shesh mevot arevaiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בֵבָ֔י שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bebai—623;
Transliteration: veney vevay shesh mevot esheriym usheloshah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י עַזְגָּ֔ד אֶ֕לֶף מָאתַ֖יִם עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Azgad—1,222;
Transliteration: veney azegad elef matayiim esheriym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי֙ אֲדֹ֣נִיקָ֔ם שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שִׁשִּׁ֥ים וְשִׁשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Adonikam—666;
Transliteration: veney adoniykam shesh mevot shishiym veshishah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בִגְוָ֔י אַלְפַּ֖יִם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וְשִׁשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bigvai—2,056;
Transliteration: veney vigevay alefayiim chamishiym veshishah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י עָדִ֔ין אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Adin—454;
Transliteration: veney adiyn areva mevot chamishiym vearevaah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵֽי־אָטֵ֥ר לִֽיחִזְקִיָּ֖ה תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Ater: Hezekiah—98;
Transliteration: veney-ater liychizekiyah tisheiym ushemonah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בֵצָ֔י שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bezai—323;
Transliteration: veney vetsay shelosh mevot esheriym usheloshah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י יוֹרָ֔ה מֵאָ֖ה וּשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Jorah—112;
Transliteration: veney yvorah meah usheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י חָשֻׁ֔ם מָאתַ֖יִם עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Hashum—223;
Transliteration: veney chashum matayiim esheriym usheloshah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י גִבָּ֖ר תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Gibbar—95;
Transliteration: veney givar tisheiym vachamishah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בֵֽית־לָ֔חֶם מֵאָ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated:
the sons of Bethlehem—
123;
Transliteration: veney veyt-lachem meah esheriym usheloshah {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֥י נְטֹפָ֖ה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וְשִׁשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Netophah—56;
Transliteration: aneshey netofah chamishiym veshishah {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֣י עֲנָת֔וֹת מֵאָ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Anathoth—128;
Transliteration: aneshey anatvot meah esheriym ushemonah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י עַזְמָ֖וֶת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Azmaveth—42;
Transliteration: veney azemavet arevaiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֨י קִרְיַ֤ת עָרִים֙ כְּפִירָ֣ה וּבְאֵר֔וֹת שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Kiriath-arim: Chephirah and Beeroth—743;
Transliteration: veney kireyat ariym khefiyrah uveervot sheva mevot vearevaiym usheloshah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י הָרָמָה֙ וָגָ֔בַע שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאֶחָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Ramah and Geba—621;
Transliteration: veney haramah vagava shesh mevot esheriym veechad {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֣י מִכְמָ֔ס מֵאָ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the men of Michmas—122;
Transliteration: aneshey mikhemas meah esheriym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֤י בֵֽית־אֵל֙ וְהָעָ֔י מָאתַ֖יִם עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the men of Bethel and Ai—223;
Transliteration: aneshey veyt-el vehaay matayiim esheriym usheloshah {s}

Translated: the sons of Magbish—156;

Transliteration: veney eylam acher elef matayiim chamishiym vearevaah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־לֹד֙ חָדִ֣יד וְאוֹנ֔וֹ שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י יְרֵח֔וֹ שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Jericho—345;
Transliteration: veney yerechvo shelosh mevot arevaiym vachamishah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י סְנָאָ֔ה שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֔ים וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Senaah—3,630.

Hebrew:
הַֽכֹּהֲנִ֑ים {פ}

Transliteration:
hakhohaniym {f}
veney yedaeyah leveyt eishua tesha mevot shiveiym usheloshah {s}

Translated: the sons of Immer—1,052;
Transliteration: veney imer elef chamishiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י פַשְׁח֔וּר אֶ֕לֶף מָאתַ֖יִם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָֽה׃ {ס}

Translated: the sons of Harim—1,017.
Transliteration: veney charim elef veshiveah ashar {s}

Hebrew: הַלְוִיִּ֑ם בְּנֵי־יֵשׁ֧וּעַ וְקַדְמִיאֵ֛ל לִבְנֵ֥י הוֹדַוְיָ֖ה שִׁבְעִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The Levites: the sons of Jeshua and Kadmiel: the sons of Hodaviah—74.
Transliteration: haleviyim veney-eishua vekademiyel liveney hvodaveyah shiveiym vearevaah {s}

Hebrew: הַֽמְשֹׁרְרִ֑ים בְּנֵ֣י אָסָ֔ף מֵאָ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The singers: the sons of Asaph—128.
Transliteration: hameshoreriym veney asaf meah esheriym ushemonah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י הַשֹּֽׁעֲרִ֗ים בְּנֵי־שַׁלּ֤וּם בְּנֵֽי־אָטֵר֙ בְּנֵי־טַלְמֹ֣ן בְּנֵי־עַקּ֔וּב בְּנֵ֥י חֲטִיטָ֖א בְּנֵ֣י שֹׁבָ֑י הַכֹּ֕ל מֵאָ֖ה שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְתִשְׁעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The gatekeepers: the sons of Shallum, the sons of Ater, the sons of Talmon, the sons of Akkub, the sons of Hatita, the sons of Shobai, all told—139.

Hebrew: הַנְּתִינִ֑ים בְּנֵי־צִיחָ֥א בְנֵי־חֲשׂוּפָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י טַבָּעֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: The temple servants: the sons of Ziha, the sons of Hasupha, the sons of Tabbaoth,
Transliteration: hanetiyniym veney-tsiycha veney-chashufa veney tavavot {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־קֵרֹ֥ס בְּֽנֵי־סִֽיעֲהָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י פָדֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Keros, the sons of Siaha, the sons of Padon,
Transliteration: veney-keros veney-siyaha veney fadvon {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־לְבָנָ֥ה בְנֵי־חֲגָבָ֖ה בְּנֵ֥י עַקּֽוּב׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Lebanah, the sons of Hagabah, the sons of Akkub,
Transliteration: veney-levanah veney-chagavah veney akuv {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־חָגָ֥ב בְּנֵי־[שַׁלְמַ֖י] (שמלי) בְּנֵ֥י חָנָֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Hagab, the sons of Salmai, the sons of Hanan,
Transliteration: veney-chagav veney-[shalemay] (shmly) veney chanan {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־גִדֵּ֥ל בְּנֵי־גַ֖חַר בְּנֵ֥י רְאָיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Giddel, the sons of Gahar, the sons of Reaiah,
Transliteration: veney-gidel veney-gachar veney reayah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־רְצִ֥ין בְּנֵי־נְקוֹדָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י גַזָּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Rezin, the sons of Nekoda, the sons of Gazzam,
Transliteration: veney-retsiyn veney-nekvoda veney gazam {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־עֻזָּ֥א בְנֵי־פָסֵ֖חַ בְּנֵ֥י בֵסָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Uzza, the sons of Paseah, the sons of Besai,
Transliteration: veney-uza veney-fasecha veney vesay {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־אַסְנָ֥ה בְנֵי־מְעוּנִ֖ים בְּנֵ֥י (נפיסים) [נְפוּסִֽים]׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Asnah, the sons of Meunim, the sons of Nephusim,
Transliteration: veney-asenah veney-meuniym veney (nfysym) [nefusiym] {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־בַקְבּ֥וּק בְּנֵי־חֲקוּפָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י חַרְחֽוּר׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bakbuk, the sons of Hakupha, the sons of Harhur,
Transliteration: veney-vakevuk veney-chakufa veney charechur {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־בַצְל֥וּת בְּנֵי־מְחִידָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י חַרְשָֽׁא׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bazluth, the sons of Mehida, the sons of Harsha,
Transliteration: veney-vatselut veney-mechiyda veney charesha {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־בַרְק֥וֹס בְּֽנֵי־סִֽיסְרָ֖א בְּנֵי־תָֽמַח׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Barkos, the sons of Sisera, the sons of Temah,
Transliteration: veney-varekvos veney-siysera veney-tamach {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י נְצִ֖יחַ בְּנֵ֥י חֲטִיפָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Neziah, the sons of Hatipha.
Transliteration: veney netsiycha veney chatiyfa {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה בְּנֵי־סֹטַ֥י בְּנֵי־הַסֹּפֶ֖רֶת בְּנֵ֥י פְרוּדָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Solomon’s servants: the sons of Sotai, the sons of Hassophereth, the sons of Peruda,
Transliteration: veney avedey shelomoh veney-sotay veney-hasoferet veney feruda {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־יַעְלָ֥ה בְנֵי־דַרְק֖וֹן בְּנֵ֥י גִדֵּֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Jaalah, the sons of Darkon, the sons of Giddel,
Transliteration: veney-yaelah veney-darekvon veney gidel {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֧י שְׁפַטְיָ֣ה בְנֵֽי־חַטִּ֗יל בְּנֵ֛י פֹּכֶ֥רֶת הַצְּבָיִ֖ים בְּנֵ֥י אָמִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Shephatiah, the sons of Hattil, the sons of Pochereth-hazzebaim, the sons of Ami.
Transliteration: veney shefateyah veney-chatiyl veney fokheret hatsevayiym veney amiy {s}

Hebrew: כׇּ֨ל־הַנְּתִינִ֔ים וּבְנֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: The total of temple servants and the sons of Solomon’s servants—392.
Transliteration: khׇl-hanetiyniym uveney avedey shelomoh shelosh mevot tisheiym ushenayiim {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה הָֽעֹלִים֙ מִתֵּ֥ל מֶ֙לַח֙ תֵּ֣ל חַרְשָׁ֔א כְּר֥וּב אַדָּ֖ן אִמֵּ֑ר וְלֹ֣א יָֽכְל֗וּ לְהַגִּ֤יד בֵּית־אֲבוֹתָם֙ וְזַרְעָ֔ם אִ֥ם מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הֵֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: The following were those who came up from Tel-melah, Tel-harsha, Cherub, Addan, and Immer—they were unable to tell whether their father’s house and descent were Israelite:
Transliteration: veeleh haoliym mitel melach tel charesha kheruv adan imer velo yakhelu lehagiyd veyt-avvotam vezaream im miyisherael hem {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־דְלָיָ֥ה בְנֵי־טוֹבִיָּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י נְקוֹדָ֑א שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Delaiah, the sons of Tobiah, the sons of Nekoda—652.
Transliteration: veney-delayah veney-tvoviyah veney nekvoda shesh mevot chamishiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵי֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים בְּנֵ֥י חֳבַיָּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י הַקּ֑וֹץ בְּנֵ֣י בַרְזִלַּ֗י אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָ֠קַ֠ח מִבְּנ֞וֹת בַּרְזִלַּ֤י הַגִּלְעָדִי֙ אִשָּׁ֔ה וַיִּקָּרֵ֖א עַל־שְׁמָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Of the sons of the priests, the sons of Habaiah, the sons of Hakkoz, the sons of Barzillai who had married a daughter of Barzillai and had taken his name—
Transliteration: umiveney hakhohaniym veney chovayah veney hakvots veney varezilay asher lakach mivenvot varezilay hagileadiy ishah vayikare al-shemam {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֗לֶּה בִּקְשׁ֧וּ כְתָבָ֛ם הַמִּתְיַחְשִׂ֖ים וְלֹ֣א נִמְצָ֑אוּ וַֽיְגֹאֲל֖וּ מִן־הַכְּהֻנָּֽה׃
Translated: these searched for their genealogical records, but they could not be found, so they were disqualified for the priesthood.
Transliteration: eleh vikeshu khetavam hamiteyacheshiym velo nimetsau vayegoalu min-hakhehunah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַתִּרְשָׁ֙תָא֙ לָהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יֹאכְל֖וּ מִקֹּ֣דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים עַ֛ד עֲמֹ֥ד כֹּהֵ֖ן לְאוּרִ֥ים וּלְתֻמִּֽים׃
Translated: The Tirshatha ordered them not to eat of the most holy things until a priest with Urim and Thummim should appear.
Transliteration: vayomer hatireshata lahem asher lo-yokhelu mikodesh hakodashiym ad amod khohen leuriym uletumiym

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַקָּהָ֖ל כְּאֶחָ֑ד אַרְבַּ֣ע רִבּ֔וֹא אַלְפַּ֖יִם שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת שִׁשִּֽׁים׃
Translated: The sum of the entire community was 42,360,
Transliteration: khׇl-hakahal kheechad areva rivvo alefayiim shelosh-mevot shishiym

Hebrew: מִ֠לְּבַ֠ד עַבְדֵיהֶ֤ם וְאַמְהֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ אֵ֔לֶּה שִׁבְעַ֣ת אֲלָפִ֔ים שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וְשִׁבְעָ֑ה וְלָהֶ֛ם מְשֹׁרְרִ֥ים וּֽמְשֹׁרְר֖וֹת מָאתָֽיִם׃
Translated: not counting their male and female servants, those being 7,337; they also had 200 male and female singers.
Transliteration: milevad avedeyhem veamehoteyhem eleh shiveat alafiym shelosh mevot sheloshiym veshiveah velahem meshoreriym umeshorervot matayiim

Hebrew: סוּסֵיהֶ֕ם שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וְשִׁשָּׁ֑ה פִּרְדֵיהֶ֕ם מָאתַ֖יִם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: Their horses—736; their mules—245;
Transliteration: suseyhem sheva mevot sheloshiym veshishah firedeyhem matayiim arevaiym vachamishah {s}

Hebrew: גְּמַ֨לֵּיהֶ֔ם אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֑ה חֲמֹרִ֕ים שֵׁ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֔ים שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וְעֶשְׂרִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: their camels—435; their asses—6,720.
Transliteration: gemaleyhem areva mevot sheloshiym vachamishah chamoriym sheshet alafiym sheva mevot veesheriym {f}

Hebrew: וּמֵרָאשֵׁי֙ הָֽאָב֔וֹת בְּבוֹאָ֕ם לְבֵ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם הִֽתְנַדְּבוּ֙ לְבֵ֣ית הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים לְהַעֲמִיד֖וֹ עַל־מְכוֹנֽוֹ׃
Translated: Some of the chiefs of the clans, on arriving at the House of the L<small>ORD</small> in Jerusalem, gave a freewill offering to erect the House of God on its site.
Transliteration: umerashey haavvot vevvoam leveyt yehovah asher viyrushala͏im hitenadevu leveyt haElohimm lehaamiydvo al-mekhvonvo

Hebrew: כְּכֹחָ֗ם נָתְנוּ֮ לְאוֹצַ֣ר הַמְּלָאכָה֒ זָהָ֗ב דַּרְכְּמוֹנִים֙ שֵׁשׁ־רִבֹּ֣אות וָאֶ֔לֶף וְכֶ֕סֶף מָנִ֖ים חֲמֵ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֑ים וְכׇתְנֹ֥ת כֹּהֲנִ֖ים מֵאָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: In accord with their means, they donated to the treasury of the work: gold—61,000 drachmas, silver—5,000 minas, and priestly robes—100.
Transliteration: khekhocham natenu levotsar hamelakhah zahav darekhemvoniym shesh-rivovt vaelef vekhesef maniym chameshet alafiym vekhׇtenot khohaniym meah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְ֠הַלְוִיִּ֠ם וּֽמִן־הָעָ֞ם וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִ֧ים וְהַשּׁוֹעֲרִ֛ים וְהַנְּתִינִ֖ים בְּעָרֵיהֶ֑ם וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּעָרֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: The priests, the Levites and some of the people, and the singers, gatekeepers, and the temple servants took up residence in their towns and all Israel in their towns.
Transliteration: vayeshevu hakhohaniym vehaleviyim umin-haam vehameshoreriym vehashvoariym vehanetiyniym veareyhem vekhׇl-yisherael veareyhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּע֙ הַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י וּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בֶּעָרִ֑ים {ס} וַיֵּאָסְפ֥וּ הָעָ֛ם כְּאִ֥ישׁ אֶחָ֖ד אֶל־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: When the seventh month arrived—the Israelites being settled in their towns—the entire people assembled as one man in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayiga hachodesh hasheviyiy uveney yisherael veariym {s} vayeasefu haam kheiysh echad el-yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩קׇם֩ יֵשׁ֨וּעַ בֶּן־יֽוֹצָדָ֜ק וְאֶחָ֣יו הַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים וּזְרֻבָּבֶ֤ל בֶּן־שְׁאַלְתִּיאֵל֙ וְאֶחָ֔יו וַיִּבְנ֕וּ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֖ח אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְהַעֲל֤וֹת עָלָיו֙ עֹל֔וֹת כַּכָּת֕וּב בְּתוֹרַ֖ת מֹשֶׁ֥ה אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Then Jeshua son of Jozadak and his brother priests, and Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and his brothers set to and built the altar of the God of Israel to offer burnt offerings upon it as is written in the Teaching of Moses, the man of God.
Transliteration: vayakׇm eishua ven-yvotsadak veechayv hakhohaniym uzeruvavel ven-shealetiyel veechayv vayivenu et-mizevach elohey yisherael lehaalvot alayv olvot khakhatuv vetvorat mosheh iysh-haElohim

Hebrew: וַיָּכִ֤ינוּ הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ עַל־מְכ֣וֹנֹתָ֔יו כִּ֚י בְּאֵימָ֣ה עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם מֵעַמֵּ֖י הָאֲרָצ֑וֹת (ויעל) [וַיַּעֲל֨וּ] עָלָ֤יו עֹלוֹת֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה עֹל֖וֹת לַבֹּ֥קֶר וְלָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: They set up the altar on its site because they were in fear of the peoples of the land, and they offered burnt offerings on it to the L<small>ORD</small>, burnt offerings each morning and evening.
Transliteration: vayakhiynu hamizevecha al-mekhvonotayv khiy veeymah aleyhem meamey haaratsvot (vyl) [vayaalu] alayv olvot layhovah olvot lavoker velaarev

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֛וּ אֶת־חַ֥ג הַסֻּכּ֖וֹת כַּכָּת֑וּב וְעֹלַ֨ת י֤וֹם בְּיוֹם֙ בְּמִסְפָּ֔ר כְּמִשְׁפַּ֖ט דְּבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then they celebrated the festival of Tabernacles as is written, with its daily burnt offerings in the proper quantities, on each day as is prescribed for it,
Transliteration: vayaashu et-chag hasukhvot khakhatuv veolat yvom veyvom vemisefar khemishefat devar-yvom veyvomvo

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֞ן עֹלַ֤ת תָּמִיד֙ וְלֶ֣חֳדָשִׁ֔ים וּלְכׇל־מוֹעֲדֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה הַמְקֻדָּשִׁ֑ים וּלְכֹ֛ל מִתְנַדֵּ֥ב נְדָבָ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: followed by the regular burnt offering and the offerings for the new moons and for all the sacred fixed times of the L<small>ORD</small>, and whatever freewill offerings were made to the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen olat tamiyd velechodashiym ulekhׇl-mvoadey yehovah hamekudashiym ulekhol mitenadev nedavah layhovah

Hebrew: מִיּ֤וֹם אֶחָד֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י הֵחֵ֕לּוּ לְהַעֲל֥וֹת עֹל֖וֹת לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְהֵיכַ֥ל יְהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֥א יֻסָּֽד׃
Translated: From the first day of the seventh month they began to make burnt offerings to the L<small>ORD</small>, though the foundation of the Temple of the L<small>ORD</small> had not been laid.
Transliteration: miyyvom echad lachodesh hasheviyiy hechelu lehaalvot olvot layhovah veheykhal yehovah lo yusad

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨תְּנוּ־כֶ֔סֶף לַחֹצְבִ֖ים וְלֶחָרָשִׁ֑ים וּמַאֲכָ֨ל וּמִשְׁתֶּ֜ה וָשֶׁ֗מֶן לַצִּֽדֹנִים֙ וְלַצֹּרִ֔ים לְהָבִיא֩ עֲצֵ֨י אֲרָזִ֤ים מִן־הַלְּבָנוֹן֙ אֶל־יָ֣ם יָפ֔וֹא כְּרִשְׁי֛וֹן כּ֥וֹרֶשׁ מֶֽלֶךְ־פָּרַ֖ס עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: They paid the hewers and craftsmen with money, and the Sidonians and Tyrians with food, drink, and oil to bring cedarwood from Lebanon by sea to Joppa, in accord with the authorization granted them by King Cyrus of Persia.
Transliteration: vayitenu-khesef lachotseviym velecharashiym umaakhal umisheteh vashemen latsidoniym velatsoriym lehaviy atsey araziym min-halevanvon el-yam yafvo kherisheyvon khvoresh melekhe-faras aleyhem {f}

Hebrew: וּבַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשֵּׁנִ֗ית לְבוֹאָ֞ם אֶל־בֵּ֤ית הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ לִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם בַּחֹ֖דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֑י הֵחֵ֡לּוּ זְרֻבָּבֶ֣ל בֶּן־שְׁ֠אַלְתִּיאֵ֠ל וְיֵשׁ֨וּעַ בֶּן־יֽוֹצָדָ֜ק וּשְׁאָ֥ר אֲחֵיהֶ֣ם ׀ הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֗ם וְכׇל־הַבָּאִים֙ מֵהַשְּׁבִ֣י יְרֽוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיַּעֲמִ֣ידוּ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֗ם מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה לְנַצֵּ֖חַ עַל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת בֵּית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: In the second year after their arrival at the House of God, at Jerusalem, in the second month, Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua son of Jozadak, and the rest of their brother priests and Levites, and all who had come from the captivity to Jerusalem, as their first step appointed Levites from the age of twenty and upward to supervise the work of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: uvashanah hasheniyt levvoam el-veyt haElohim liyrushala͏im vachodesh hasheniy hechelu zeruvavel ven-shealetiyel veeishua ven-yvotsadak ushear acheyhem hakhohaniym vehaleviyim vekhׇl-havaiym mehasheviy yerushala͏im vayaamiydu et-haleviyim miven esheriym shanah vamaelah lenatsecha al-melekhet veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד יֵשׁ֡וּעַ בָּנָ֣יו וְ֠אֶחָ֠יו קַדְמִיאֵ֨ל וּבָנָ֤יו בְּנֵֽי־יְהוּדָה֙ כְּאֶחָ֔ד לְנַצֵּ֛חַ עַל־עֹשֵׂ֥ה הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה בְּבֵ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים {ס} בְּנֵי֙ חֵֽנָדָ֔ד בְּנֵיהֶ֥ם וַאֲחֵיהֶ֖ם הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: Jeshua, his sons and brothers, Kadmiel and his sons, the sons of Judah, together were appointed in charge of those who did the work in the House of God; also the sons of Henadad, their sons and brother Levites.
Transliteration: vayaamod eishua vanayv veechayv kademiyel uvanayv veney-yehudah kheechad lenatsecha al-osheh hamelakhah veveyt haElohim {s} veney chenadad veneyhem vaacheyhem haleviyim

Hebrew: וְיִסְּד֥וּ הַבֹּנִ֖ים אֶת־הֵיכַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּעֲמִ֩ידוּ֩ הַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים מְלֻבָּשִׁ֜ים בַּחֲצֹֽצְר֗וֹת וְהַלְוִיִּ֤ם בְּנֵֽי־אָסָף֙ בַּֽמְצִלְתַּ֔יִם לְהַלֵּל֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־יְדֵ֖י דָּוִ֥יד מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: When the builders had laid the foundation of the Temple of the L<small>ORD</small>, priests in their vestments with trumpets, and Levites sons of Asaph with cymbals were stationed to give praise to the L<small>ORD</small>, as King David of Israel had ordained.
Transliteration: veyisedu havoniym et-heykhal yehovah vayaamiydu hakhohaniym meluvashiym vachatsotservot vehaleviyim veney-asaf vametsiletayiim lehalel et-yehovah al-yedey daviyd melekhe-yisherael

Hebrew: וַֽ֠יַּעֲנ֠וּ בְּהַלֵּ֨ל וּבְהוֹדֹ֤ת לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כִּ֣י ט֔וֹב כִּֽי־לְעוֹלָ֥ם חַסְדּ֖וֹ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכׇל־הָעָ֡ם הֵרִ֩יעוּ֩ תְרוּעָ֨ה גְדוֹלָ֤ה בְהַלֵּל֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה עַ֖ל הוּסַ֥ד בֵּית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They sang songs extolling and praising the L<small>ORD</small>, “For He is good, His steadfast love for Israel is eternal.” All the people raised a great shout extolling the L<small>ORD</small> because the foundation of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> had been laid.
Transliteration: vayaanu vehalel uvehvodot layhovah khiy tvov khiy-levolam chasedvo al-yisherael vekhׇl-haam heriyu teruah gedvolah vehalel layhovah al husad veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: וְרַבִּ֡ים מֵהַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהַלְוִיִּם֩ וְרָאשֵׁ֨י הָאָב֜וֹת הַזְּקֵנִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר רָא֜וּ אֶת־הַבַּ֤יִת הָֽרִאשׁוֹן֙ בְּיׇסְד֔וֹ זֶ֤ה הַבַּ֙יִת֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיהֶ֔ם בֹּכִ֖ים בְּק֣וֹל גָּד֑וֹל וְרַבִּ֛ים בִּתְרוּעָ֥ה בְשִׂמְחָ֖ה לְהָרִ֥ים קֽוֹל׃
Translated: Many of the priests and Levites and the chiefs of the clans, the old men who had seen the first house, wept loudly at the sight of the founding of this house. Many others shouted joyously at the top of their voices.
Transliteration: veraviym mehakhohaniym vehaleviyim verashey haavvot hazekeniym asher rau et-havayiit harishvon veyׇsedvo zeh havayiit veeyneyhem vokhiym vekvol gadvol veraviym viteruah veshimechah lehariym kvol

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ין הָעָ֗ם מַכִּירִים֙ ק֚וֹל תְּרוּעַ֣ת הַשִּׂמְחָ֔ה לְק֖וֹל בְּכִ֣י הָעָ֑ם כִּ֣י הָעָ֗ם מְרִיעִים֙ תְּרוּעָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֔ה וְהַקּ֥וֹל נִשְׁמַ֖ע עַד־לְמֵרָחֽוֹק׃ {פ}
Translated: The people could not distinguish the shouts of joy from the people’s weeping, for the people raised a great shout, the sound of which could be heard from afar.
Transliteration: veeyn haam makhiyriym kvol teruat hashimechah lekvol vekhiy haam khiy haam meriyiym teruah gedvolah vehakvol nishema ad-lemerachvok {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֔וּ צָרֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה וּבִנְיָמִ֑ן כִּֽי־בְנֵ֤י הַגּוֹלָה֙ בּוֹנִ֣ים הֵיכָ֔ל לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: When the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the returned exiles were building a temple to the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel,
Transliteration: vayishemeu tsarey yehudah uvineyamin khiy-veney hagvolah vvoniym heykhal layhovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּגְּשׁ֨וּ אֶל־זְרֻבָּבֶ֜ל וְאֶל־רָאשֵׁ֣י הָֽאָב֗וֹת וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ לָהֶם֙ נִבְנֶ֣ה עִמָּכֶ֔ם כִּ֣י כָכֶ֔ם נִדְר֖וֹשׁ לֵֽאלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם (ולא) [וְל֣וֹ ׀] אֲנַ֣חְנוּ זֹבְחִ֗ים מִימֵי֙ אֵסַ֤ר חַדֹּן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר הַמַּעֲלֶ֥ה אֹתָ֖נוּ פֹּֽה׃
Translated: they approached Zerubbabel and the chiefs of the clans and said to them, “Let us build with you, since we too worship your God, having offered sacrifices to Him since the time of King Esarhaddon of Assyria, who brought us here.”
Transliteration: vayigeshu el-zeruvavel veel-rashey haavvot vayomeru lahem niveneh imakhem khiy khakhem nidervosh leloheykhem (vl) [velvo ] anachenu zovechiym miymey esar chadon melekhe ashur hamaaleh otanu foh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ לָהֶ֨ם זְרֻבָּבֶ֜ל וְיֵשׁ֗וּעַ וּשְׁאָ֨ר רָאשֵׁ֤י הָֽאָבוֹת֙ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹֽא־לָכֶ֣ם וָלָ֔נוּ לִבְנ֥וֹת בַּ֖יִת לֵאלֹהֵ֑ינוּ כִּי֩ אֲנַ֨חְנוּ יַ֜חַד נִבְנֶ֗ה לַֽיהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֔נוּ הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ כּ֥וֹרֶשׁ מֶֽלֶךְ־פָּרָֽס׃
Translated: Zerubbabel, Jeshua, and the rest of the chiefs of the clans of Israel answered them, “It is not for you and us to build a House to our God, but we alone will build it to the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel, in accord with the charge that the king, King Cyrus of Persia, laid upon us.”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem zeruvavel veeishua ushear rashey haavvot leyisherael lo-lakhem valanu livenvot vayiit leloheynu khiy anachenu yachad niveneh layhovah elohey yisherael khaasher tsivanu hamelekhe khvoresh melekhe-faras

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ עַם־הָאָ֔רֶץ מְרַפִּ֖ים יְדֵ֣י עַם־יְהוּדָ֑ה (ומבלהים) [וּֽמְבַהֲלִ֥ים] אוֹתָ֖ם לִבְנֽוֹת׃
Translated: Thereupon the people of the land undermined the resolve of the people of Judah, and made them afraid to build.
Transliteration: vayehiy am-haarets merafiym yedey am-yehudah (vmvlhym) [umevahaliym] votam livenvot

Hebrew: וְסֹכְרִ֧ים עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם יוֹעֲצִ֖ים לְהָפֵ֣ר עֲצָתָ֑ם כׇּל־יְמֵ֗י כּ֚וֹרֶשׁ מֶ֣לֶךְ פָּרַ֔ס וְעַד־מַלְכ֖וּת דָּרְיָ֥וֶשׁ מֶֽלֶךְ־פָּרָֽס׃
Translated: They bribed ministers in order to thwart their plans all the years of King Cyrus of Persia and until the reign of King Darius of Persia.
Transliteration: vesokheriym aleyhem yvoatsiym lehafer atsatam khׇl-yemey khvoresh melekhe faras vead-malekhut dareyavesh melekhe-faras

Hebrew: וּבְמַלְכוּת֙ אֲחַשְׁוֵר֔וֹשׁ בִּתְחִלַּ֖ת מַלְכוּת֑וֹ כָּתְב֣וּ שִׂטְנָ֔ה עַל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: And in the reign of Ahasuerus, at the start of his reign, they drew up an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.
Transliteration: uvemalekhut achashevervosh vitechilat malekhutvo khatevu shitenah al-yoshevey yehudah viyrushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וּבִימֵ֣י אַרְתַּחְשַׁ֗שְׂתָּא כָּתַ֨ב בִּשְׁלָ֜ם מִתְרְדָ֤ת טָֽבְאֵל֙ וּשְׁאָ֣ר כְּנָוֺתָ֔ו עַל־אַרְתַּחְשַׁ֖שְׂתְּא מֶ֣לֶךְ פָּרָ֑ס וּכְתָב֙ הַֽנִּשְׁתְּוָ֔ן כָּת֥וּב אֲרָמִ֖ית וּמְתֻרְגָּ֥ם אֲרָמִֽית׃ {פ}
Translated:
And in the time of Artaxerxes, Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of their colleagues wrote to King Artaxerxes of Persia, a letter written in Aramaic and translated.

Aramaic:
Transliteration: uviymey aretacheshasheta khatav vishelam miteredat taveel ushear khenavotav al-aretacheshashete melekhe faras ukhetav hanishetevan khatuv aramiyt umeturegam aramiyt {f}

Hebrew: רְח֣וּם בְּעֵל־טְעֵ֗ם וְשִׁמְשַׁי֙ סָֽפְרָ֔א כְּתַ֛בוּ אִגְּרָ֥ה חֲדָ֖ה עַל־יְרוּשְׁלֶ֑ם לְאַרְתַּחְשַׁ֥שְׂתְּא מַלְכָּ֖א כְּנֵֽמָא׃
Translated: Rehum the commissioner and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter concerning Jerusalem to King Artaxerxes as follows: (
Transliteration: rechum veel-teem veshimeshay safera khetavu igerah chadah al-yerushelem learetacheshashete malekha khenema

Hebrew: אֱדַ֜יִן רְח֣וּם בְּעֵל־טְעֵ֗ם וְשִׁמְשַׁי֙ סָֽפְרָ֔א וּשְׁאָ֖ר כְּנָוָתְה֑וֹן דִּ֠ינָיֵ֠א וַאֲפַרְסַתְכָיֵ֞א טַרְפְּלָיֵ֣א אֲפָֽרְסָיֵ֗א (ארכוי) [אַרְכֳּוָיֵ֤א] בָבְלָיֵא֙ שֽׁוּשַׁנְכָיֵ֔א (דהוא) [דֶּהָיֵ֖א] עֵלְמָיֵֽא׃
Translated: Then Rehum the commissioner and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their colleagues, the judges, officials, officers, and overseers, the men of Erech, and of Babylon, and of Susa—that is the Elamites—
Transliteration: edayiin rechum veel-teem veshimeshay safera ushear khenavatehvon diynaei vaafaresatekhaei tarefelaei afaresaei (rkhvy) [arekhovaei] vavelaei shushanekhaei (dhv) [dehaei] elemaei

Hebrew: וּשְׁאָ֣ר אֻמַּיָּ֗א דִּ֤י הַגְלִי֙ אׇסְנַפַּר֙ רַבָּ֣א וְיַקִּירָ֔א וְהוֹתֵ֣ב הִמּ֔וֹ בְּקִרְיָ֖ה דִּ֣י שָׁמְרָ֑יִן וּשְׁאָ֥ר עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֖ה וּכְעֶֽנֶת׃
Translated: and other peoples whom the great and glorious Osnappar deported and settled in the city of Samaria and the rest of the province Beyond the River [wrote]—and now
Transliteration: ushear umaya diy hageliy ׇsenafar rava veyakiyra vehvotev himvo vekireyah diy shamerayiin ushear avar-naharah ukheenet

Hebrew: דְּנָה֙ פַּרְשֶׁ֣גֶן אִגַּרְתָּ֔א דִּ֚י שְׁלַ֣חוּ עֲל֔וֹהִי עַל־אַרְתַּחְשַׁ֖שְׂתְּא מַלְכָּ֑א (עבדיך) [עַבְדָ֛ךְ] אֱנָ֥שׁ עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֖ה וּכְעֶֽנֶת׃ {פ}
Translated: this is the text of the letter which they sent to him:)—“To King Artaxerxes [from] your servants, men of the province Beyond the River. And now
Transliteration: denah fareshegen igareta diy shelachu alvohiy al-aretacheshashete malekha (vdykh) [avedakhe] enash avar-naharah ukheenet {f}

Hebrew: יְדִ֙יעַ֙ לֶהֱוֵ֣א לְמַלְכָּ֔א דִּ֣י יְהוּדָיֵ֗א דִּ֤י סְלִ֙קוּ֙ מִן־לְוָתָ֔ךְ עֲלֶ֥ינָא אֲת֖וֹ לִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם קִרְיְתָ֨א מָֽרָדְתָּ֤א וּבִֽאישְׁתָּא֙ בָּנַ֔יִן (ושורי) [וְשׁוּרַיָּ֣א] (אשכללו) [שַׁכְלִ֔ילוּ] וְאֻשַּׁיָּ֖א יַחִֽיטוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: be it known to the king that the Jews who came up from you to us have reached Jerusalem and are rebuilding that rebellious and wicked city; they are completing the walls and repairing the foundation.
Transliteration: yediya leheve lemalekha diy yehudaei diy seliku min-levatakhe aleyna atvo liyrushelem kireyeta maradeta uviysheta vanayiin (vshvry) [veshuraya] (shkhllv) [shakheliylu] veushaya yachiytu {s}

Hebrew: כְּעַ֗ן יְדִ֙יעַ֙ לֶהֱוֵ֣א לְמַלְכָּ֔א דִּ֠י הֵ֣ן קִרְיְתָ֥א דָךְ֙ תִּתְבְּנֵ֔א וְשׁוּרַיָּ֖א יִֽשְׁתַּכְלְל֑וּן מִנְדָּֽה־בְל֤וֹ וַהֲלָךְ֙ לָ֣א יִנְתְּנ֔וּן וְאַפְּתֹ֥ם מַלְכִ֖ים תְּהַנְזִֽק׃ {ס}
Translated: Now be it known to the king that if this city is rebuilt and the walls completed, they will not pay tribute, poll-tax, or land-tax, and in the end it will harm the kingdom.
Transliteration: khean yediya leheve lemalekha diy hen kireyeta dakhe titevene veshuraya yishetakhelelun minedah-velvo vahalakhe la yinetenun veafetom malekhiym tehanezik {s}

Hebrew: כְּעַ֗ן כׇּל־קֳבֵל֙ דִּֽי־מְלַ֤ח הֵֽיכְלָא֙ מְלַ֔חְנָא וְעַרְוַ֣ת מַלְכָּ֔א לָ֥א אֲֽרִֽיךְ־לַ֖נָא לְמֶֽחֱזֵ֑א עַ֨ל־דְּנָ֔ה שְׁלַ֖חְנָא וְהוֹדַ֥עְנָא לְמַלְכָּֽא׃
Translated: Now since we eat the salt of the palace, and it is not right that we should see the king dishonored, we have written to advise the king [of this]
Transliteration: khean khׇl-kovel diy-melach heykhela melachena vearevat malekha la ariykhe-lana lemecheze al-denah shelachena vehvodaena lemalekha

Hebrew: דִּ֡י יְבַקַּר֩ בִּֽסְפַר־דׇּכְרָ֨נַיָּ֜א דִּ֣י אֲבָהָתָ֗ךְ וּ֠תְהַשְׁכַּ֠ח בִּסְפַ֣ר דׇּכְרָנַיָּא֮ וְתִנְדַּע֒ דִּי֩ קִרְיְתָ֨א דָ֜ךְ קִרְיָ֣א מָֽרָדָ֗א וּֽמְהַנְזְקַ֤ת מַלְכִין֙ וּמְדִנָ֔ן וְאֶשְׁתַּדּוּר֙ עָבְדִ֣ין בְּגַוַּ֔הּ מִן־יוֹמָ֖ת עָלְמָ֑א עַ֨ל־דְּנָ֔ה קִרְיְתָ֥א דָ֖ךְ הׇֽחָרְבַֽת׃
Translated: so that you may search the records of your fathers and find in the records and know that this city is a rebellious city, harmful to kings and states. Sedition has been rife in it from early times; on that account this city was destroyed.
Transliteration: diy yevakar visefar-dׇkheranaya diy avahatakhe utehashekhach visefar dׇkheranaya vetineda diy kireyeta dakhe kireya marada umehanezekat malekhiyn umedinan veeshetadur avediyn vegavah min-yvomat alema al-denah kireyeta dakhe hׇcharevat

Hebrew: מְהוֹדְעִ֤ין אֲנַ֙חְנָה֙ לְמַלְכָּ֔א דִּ֠י הֵ֣ן קִרְיְתָ֥א דָךְ֙ תִּתְבְּנֵ֔א וְשׁוּרַיָּ֖ה יִֽשְׁתַּכְלְל֑וּן לׇקֳבֵ֣ל דְּנָ֔ה חֲלָק֙ בַּעֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֔א לָ֥א אִיתַ֖י לָֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: We advise the king that if this city is rebuilt and its walls are completed, you will no longer have any portion in the province Beyond the River.”
Transliteration: mehvodeiyn anachenah lemalekha diy hen kireyeta dakhe titevene veshurayah yishetakhelelun lׇkovel denah chalak vaavar nahara la iytay lakhe {f}

Hebrew: פִּתְגָמָ֞א שְׁלַ֣ח מַלְכָּ֗א עַל־רְח֤וּם בְּעֵל־טְעֵם֙ וְשִׁמְשַׁ֣י סָֽפְרָ֔א וּשְׁאָר֙ כְּנָוָ֣תְה֔וֹן דִּ֥י יָתְבִ֖ין בְּשָֽׁמְרָ֑יִן וּשְׁאָ֧ר עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֛ה שְׁלָ֖ם וּכְעֶֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: The king sent back the following message: “To Rehum the commissioner and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their colleagues, who dwell in Samaria and in the rest of the province of Beyond the River, greetings. Now
Transliteration: fitegama shelach malekha al-rechum veel-teem veshimeshay safera ushear khenavatehvon diy yateviyn veshamerayiin ushear avar-naharah shelam ukheet {f}

Hebrew: נִשְׁתְּוָנָ֕א דִּ֥י שְׁלַחְתּ֖וּן עֲלֶ֑ינָא מְפָרַ֥שׁ קֱרִ֖י קׇדָמָֽי׃
Translated: the letter that you wrote me has been read to me in translation.
Transliteration: nishetevana diy shelachetun aleyna mefarash keriy kׇdamay

Hebrew: וּמִנִּי֮ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵם֒ וּבַקַּ֣רוּ וְהַשְׁכַּ֔חוּ דִּ֚י קִרְיְתָ֣א דָ֔ךְ מִן־יוֹמָת֙ עָֽלְמָ֔א עַל־מַלְכִ֖ין מִֽתְנַשְּׂאָ֑ה וּמְרַ֥ד וְאֶשְׁתַּדּ֖וּר מִתְעֲבֶד־בַּֽהּ׃
Translated: At my order a search has been made, and it has been found that this city has from earliest times risen against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been rife in it.
Transliteration: uminiy shiym teem uvakaru vehashekhachu diy kireyeta dakhe min-yvomat alema al-malekhiyn mitenasheah umerad veeshetadur miteaved-vah

Hebrew: וּמַלְכִ֣ין תַּקִּיפִ֗ין הֲווֹ֙ עַל־יְר֣וּשְׁלֶ֔ם וְשַׁ֨לִּיטִ֔ין בְּכֹ֖ל עֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֑ה וּמִדָּ֥ה בְל֛וֹ וַהֲלָ֖ךְ מִתְיְהֵ֥ב לְהֽוֹן׃
Translated: Powerful kings have ruled over Jerusalem and exercised authority over the whole province of Beyond the River, and tribute, poll-tax, and land-tax were paid to them.
Transliteration: umalekhiyn takiyfiyn havvo al-yerushelem veshaliytiyn vekhol avar naharah umidah velvo vahalakhe miteyehev lehvon

Hebrew: כְּעַן֙ שִׂ֣ימוּ טְּעֵ֔ם לְבַטָּלָ֖א גֻּבְרַיָּ֣א אִלֵּ֑ךְ וְקִרְיְתָ֥א דָךְ֙ לָ֣א תִתְבְּנֵ֔א עַד־מִנִּ֖י טַעְמָ֥א יִתְּשָֽׂם׃
Translated: Now issue an order to stop these men; this city is not to be rebuilt until I so order.
Transliteration: khean shiymu teem levatala guveraya ilekhe vekireyeta dakhe la titevene ad-miniy taema yitesham

Hebrew: וּזְהִירִ֥ין הֱו֛וֹ שָׁל֖וּ לְמֶעְבַּ֣ד עַל־דְּנָ֑ה לְמָה֙ יִשְׂגֵּ֣א חֲבָלָ֔א לְהַנְזָקַ֖ת מַלְכִֽין׃ {ס}
Translated: Take care not to be lax in this matter or there will be much damage and harm to the kingdom.”
Transliteration: uzehiyriyn hevvo shalu lemeevad al-denah lemah yishege chavala lehanezakat malekhiyn {s}

Hebrew: אֱדַ֗יִן מִן־דִּ֞י פַּרְשֶׁ֤גֶן נִשְׁתְּוָנָא֙ דִּ֚י אַרְתַּחְשַׁ֣שְׂתְּא מַלְכָּ֔א קֱרִ֧י קֳדָם־רְח֛וּם וְשִׁמְשַׁ֥י סָפְרָ֖א וּכְנָוָתְה֑וֹן אֲזַ֨לוּ בִבְהִיל֤וּ לִירֽוּשְׁלֶם֙ עַל־יְה֣וּדָיֵ֔א וּבַטִּ֥לוּ הִמּ֖וֹ בְּאֶדְרָ֥ע וְחָֽיִל׃ {ס}
Translated: When the text of the letter of King Artaxerxes was read before Rehum and Shimshai the scribe and their colleagues, they hurried to Jerusalem, to the Jews, and stopped them by main force.
Transliteration: edayiin min-diy fareshegen nishetevana diy aretacheshashete malekha keriy kodam-rechum veshimeshay safera ukhenavatehvon azalu vivehiylu liyrushelem al-yehudaei uvatilu himvo veedera vechayiil {s}

Hebrew: בֵּאדַ֗יִן בְּטֵלַת֙ עֲבִידַ֣ת בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֔א דִּ֖י בִּירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וַהֲוָת֙ בָּֽטְלָ֔א עַ֚ד שְׁנַ֣ת תַּרְתֵּ֔ין לְמַלְכ֖וּת דָּרְיָ֥וֶשׁ מֶֽלֶךְ־פָּרָֽס׃ {פ}
Translated: At that time, work on the House of God in Jerusalem stopped and remained in abeyance until the second year of the reign of King Darius of Persia.
Transliteration: vedayiin vetelat aviydat veyt-elaha diy viyrushelem vahavat vatela ad shenat tareteyn lemalekhut dareyavesh melekhe-faras {f}

Hebrew: וְהִתְנַבִּ֞י חַגַּ֣י (נביאה) [נְבִיָּ֗א] וּזְכַרְיָ֤ה בַר־עִדּוֹא֙ נְבִיַּאיָּ֔א עַל־יְה֣וּדָיֵ֔א דִּ֥י בִיה֖וּד וּבִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם בְּשֻׁ֛ם אֱלָ֥הּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֲלֵיהֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: Then the prophets, Haggai the prophet and Zechariah son of Iddo, prophesied to the Jews in Judah and Jerusalem, inspired by the God of Israel.
Transliteration: vehitenaviy chagay (nvyh) [neviya] uzekhareyah var-idvo neviyaya al-yehudaei diy viyhud uviyrushelem veshum elah yisherael aleyhvon {s}

Hebrew: בֵּאדַ֡יִן קָ֠מוּ זְרֻבָּבֶ֤ל בַּר־שְׁאַלְתִּיאֵל֙ וְיֵשׁ֣וּעַ בַּר־יֽוֹצָדָ֔ק וְשָׁרִ֣יו לְמִבְנֵ֔א בֵּ֥ית אֱלָהָ֖א דִּ֣י בִירֽוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וְעִמְּה֛וֹן נְבִיַּאיָּ֥א דִֽי־אֱלָהָ֖א מְסָעֲדִ֥ין לְהֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: Thereupon Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua son of Jozadak began rebuilding the House of God in Jerusalem, with the full support of the prophets of God.
Transliteration: vedayiin kamu zeruvavel var-shealetiyel veeishua var-yvotsadak veshariyv lemivene veyt elaha diy viyrushelem veimehvon neviyaya diy-elaha mesaadiyn lehvon {f}

Hebrew: בֵּהּ־זִמְנָא֩ אֲתָ֨ה עֲלֵיה֜וֹן תַּ֠תְּנַ֠י פַּחַ֧ת עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֛ה וּשְׁתַ֥ר בּוֹזְנַ֖י וּכְנָוָתְה֑וֹן וְכֵן֙ אָמְרִ֣ין לְהֹ֔ם מַן־שָׂ֨ם לְכֹ֜ם טְעֵ֗ם בַּיְתָ֤א דְנָה֙ לִבְּנֵ֔א וְאֻשַּׁרְנָ֥א דְנָ֖ה לְשַׁכְלָלָֽה׃
Translated: At once Tattenai, governor of the province of Beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai, and their colleagues descended upon them and said this to them, “Who issued orders to you to rebuild this house and complete its furnishing?”
Transliteration: veh-zimena atah aleyhvon tatenay fachat avar-naharah ushetar vvozenay ukhenavatehvon vekhen ameriyn lehom man-sham lekhom teem vayeta denah livene veusharena denah leshakhelalah

Hebrew: אֱדַ֥יִן כְּנֵ֖מָא אֲמַ֣רְנָא לְּהֹ֑ם מַן־אִנּוּן֙ שְׁמָהָ֣ת גֻּבְרַיָּ֔א דִּֽי־דְנָ֥ה בִנְיָנָ֖א בָּנַֽיִן׃
Translated: Then we said to them, “What are the names of the men who are engaged in the building?”
Transliteration: edayiin khenema amarena lehom man-inun shemahat guveraya diy-denah vineyana vanayiin

Hebrew: וְעֵ֣ין אֱלָהֲהֹ֗ם הֲוָת֙ עַל־שָׂבֵ֣י יְהוּדָיֵ֔א וְלָא־בַטִּ֣לוּ הִמּ֔וֹ עַד־טַעְמָ֖א לְדָרְיָ֣וֶשׁ יְהָ֑ךְ וֶאֱדַ֛יִן יְתִיב֥וּן נִשְׁתְּוָנָ֖א עַל־דְּנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: But God watched over the elders of the Jews and they were not stopped while a report went to Darius and a letter was sent back in reply to it.
Transliteration: veeyn elahahom havat al-shavey yehudaei vela-vatilu himvo ad-taema ledareyavesh yehakhe veedayiin yetiyvun nishetevana al-denah {f}

Hebrew: פַּרְשֶׁ֣גֶן אִ֠גַּרְתָּ֠א דִּֽי־שְׁלַ֞ח תַּתְּנַ֣י ׀ פַּחַ֣ת עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֗ה וּשְׁתַ֤ר בּוֹזְנַי֙ וּכְנָ֣וָתֵ֔הּ אֲפַ֨רְסְכָיֵ֔א דִּ֖י בַּעֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֑ה עַל־דָּרְיָ֖וֶשׁ מַלְכָּֽא׃
Translated: This is the text of the letter that Tattenai, governor of the province of Beyond the River, and Shethar-bozenai and his colleagues, the officials of Beyond the River, sent to King Darius.
Transliteration: fareshegen igareta diy-shelach tatenay fachat avar-naharah ushetar vvozenay ukhenavateh afaresekhaei diy vaavar naharah al-dareyavesh malekha

Hebrew: פִּתְגָמָ֖א שְׁלַ֣חוּ עֲל֑וֹהִי וְכִדְנָה֙ כְּתִ֣יב בְּגַוֵּ֔הּ לְדָרְיָ֥וֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֖א שְׁלָמָ֥א כֹֽלָּא׃ {ס}
Translated: They sent a message to him and this is what was written in it: “To King Darius, greetings, and so forth.
Transliteration: fitegama shelachu alvohiy vekhidenah khetiyv vegaveh ledareyavesh malekha shelama khola {s}

Hebrew: יְדִ֣יעַ ׀ לֶהֱוֵ֣א לְמַלְכָּ֗א דִּֽי־אֲזַ֜לְנָא לִיה֤וּד מְדִֽינְתָּא֙ לְבֵית֙ אֱלָהָ֣א רַבָּ֔א וְה֤וּא מִתְבְּנֵא֙ אֶ֣בֶן גְּלָ֔ל וְאָ֖ע מִתְּשָׂ֣ם בְּכֻתְלַיָּ֑א וַעֲבִ֥ידְתָּא דָ֛ךְ אׇסְפַּ֥רְנָא מִתְעַבְדָ֖א וּמַצְלַ֥ח בְּיֶדְהֹֽם׃
Translated: Be it known to the king, that we went to the province of Judah, to the house of the great God. It is being rebuilt of hewn stone, and wood is being laid in the walls. The work is being done with dispatch and is going well.
Transliteration: yediya leheve lemalekha diy-azalena liyhud mediyneta leveyt elaha rava vehu mitevene even gelal vea mitesham vekhutelaya vaaviydeta dakhe ׇsefarena miteaveda umatselach veyedehom

Hebrew: אֱדַ֗יִן שְׁאֵ֙לְנָא֙ לְשָׂבַיָּ֣א אִלֵּ֔ךְ כְּנֵ֖מָא אֲמַ֣רְנָא לְּהֹ֑ם מַן־שָׂ֨ם לְכֹ֜ם טְעֵ֗ם בַּיְתָ֤א דְנָה֙ לְמִבְנְיָ֔ה וְאֻשַּׁרְנָ֥א דְנָ֖ה לְשַׁכְלָלָֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon we directed this question to these elders, ‘Who issued orders to you to rebuild this house and to complete its furnishings?’
Transliteration: edayiin sheelena leshavaya ilekhe khenema amarena lehom man-sham lekhom teem vayeta denah lemiveneyah veusharena denah leshakhelalah

Hebrew: וְאַ֧ף שְׁמָהָתְהֹ֛ם שְׁאֵ֥לְנָא לְּהֹ֖ם לְהוֹדָעוּתָ֑ךְ דִּ֛י נִכְתֻּ֥ב שֻׁם־גֻּבְרַיָּ֖א דִּ֥י בְרָאשֵׁיהֹֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: We also asked their names so that we could write down the names of their leaders for your information.
Transliteration: veaf shemahatehom sheelena lehom lehvodautakhe diy nikhetuv shum-guveraya diy verasheyhom {f}

Hebrew: וּכְנֵ֥מָא פִתְגָמָ֖א הֲתִיב֣וּנָא לְמֵמַ֑ר אֲנַ֣חְנָא הִמּ֡וֹ עַבְד֩וֹהִי֩ דִֽי־אֱלָ֨הּ שְׁמַיָּ֜א וְאַרְעָ֗א וּבָנַ֤יִן בַּיְתָא֙ דִּֽי־הֲוָ֨א בְנֵ֜ה מִקַּדְמַ֤ת דְּנָה֙ שְׁנִ֣ין שַׂגִּיאָ֔ן וּמֶ֤לֶךְ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ רַ֔ב בְּנָ֖הִי וְשַׁכְלְלֵֽהּ׃
Translated: This is what they answered us: ‘We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth; we are rebuilding the house that was originally built many years ago; a great king of Israel built it and completed it.
Transliteration: ukhenema fitegama hatiyvuna lememar anachena himvo avedvohiy diy-elah shemaya vearea uvanayiin vayeta diy-hava veneh mikademat denah sheniyn shagiyan umelekhe leyisherael rav venahiy veshakheleleh

Hebrew: לָהֵ֗ן מִן־דִּ֨י הַרְגִּ֤זוּ אֲבָהָתַ֙נָא֙ לֶאֱלָ֣הּ שְׁמַיָּ֔א יְהַ֣ב הִמּ֔וֹ בְּיַ֛ד נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּ֥ר מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל (כסדיא) [כַּסְדָּאָ֑ה] וּבַיְתָ֤ה דְנָה֙ סַתְרֵ֔הּ וְעַמָּ֖ה הַגְלִ֥י לְבָבֶֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: But because our fathers angered the God of Heaven, He handed them over to Nebuchadnezzar the Chaldean, king of Babylon, who demolished this house and exiled the people to Babylon.
Transliteration: lahen min-diy haregizu avahatana leelah shemaya yehav himvo veyad nevukhadenetsar melekhe-vavel (khsdy) [khasedaah] uvayetah denah satereh veamah hageliy levavel {f}

Hebrew: בְּרַם֙ בִּשְׁנַ֣ת חֲדָ֔ה לְכ֥וֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֖א דִּ֣י בָבֶ֑ל כּ֤וֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּא֙ שָׂ֣ם טְעֵ֔ם בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֥א דְנָ֖ה לִבְּנֵֽא׃
Translated: But in the first year of King Cyrus of Babylon, King Cyrus issued an order to rebuild this House of God.
Transliteration: veram vishenat chadah lekhvoresh malekha diy vavel khvoresh malekha sham teem veyt-elaha denah livene

Hebrew: וְ֠אַ֠ף מָאנַיָּ֣א דִֽי־בֵית־אֱלָהָא֮ דִּ֣י דַהֲבָ֣ה וְכַסְפָּא֒ דִּ֣י נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּ֗ר הַנְפֵּק֙ מִן־הֵֽיכְלָא֙ דִּ֣י בִֽירוּשְׁלֶ֔ם וְהֵיבֵ֣ל הִמּ֔וֹ לְהֵיכְלָ֖א דִּ֣י בָבֶ֑ל הַנְפֵּ֨ק הִמּ֜וֹ כּ֣וֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֗א מִן־הֵֽיכְלָא֙ דִּ֣י בָבֶ֔ל וִיהִ֙יבוּ֙ לְשֵׁשְׁבַּצַּ֣ר שְׁמֵ֔הּ דִּ֥י פֶחָ֖ה שָׂמֵֽהּ׃
Translated: Also the silver and gold vessels of the House of God that Nebuchadnezzar had taken away from the temple in Jerusalem and brought to the temple in Babylon—King Cyrus released them from the temple in Babylon to be given to the one called Sheshbazzar whom he had appointed governor.
Transliteration: veaf manaya diy-veyt-elaha diy dahavah vekhasefa diy nevukhadenetsar hanefek min-heykhela diy viyrushelem veheyvel himvo leheykhela diy vavel hanefek himvo khvoresh malekha min-heykhela diy vavel viyhiyvu lesheshevatsar shemeh diy fechah shameh

Hebrew: וַאֲמַר־לֵ֓הּ ׀ (אלה) [אֵ֚ל] מָֽאנַיָּ֔א שֵׂ֚א אֵֽזֶל־אֲחֵ֣ת הִמּ֔וֹ בְּהֵיכְלָ֖א דִּ֣י בִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וּבֵ֥ית אֱלָהָ֖א יִתְבְּנֵ֥א עַל־אַתְרֵֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: He said to him, “Take these vessels, go, deposit them in the temple in Jerusalem, and let the House of God be rebuilt on its original site.”
Transliteration: vaamar-leh (lh) [el] manaya she ezel-achet himvo veheykhela diy viyrushelem uveyt elaha yitevene al-atereh {f}

Hebrew: אֱדַ֙יִן֙ שֵׁשְׁבַּצַּ֣ר דֵּ֔ךְ אֲתָ֗א יְהַ֧ב אֻשַּׁיָּ֛א דִּי־בֵ֥ית אֱלָהָ֖א דִּ֣י בִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וּמִן־אֱדַ֧יִן וְעַד־כְּעַ֛ן מִתְבְּנֵ֖א וְלָ֥א שְׁלִֽם׃
Translated: That same Sheshbazzar then came and laid the foundations for the House of God in Jerusalem; and ever since then it has been under construction, but is not yet finished.’
Transliteration: edayiin sheshevatsar dekhe ata yehav ushaya diy-veyt elaha diy viyrushelem umin-edayiin vead-khean mitevene vela shelim

Hebrew: וּכְעַ֞ן הֵ֧ן עַל־מַלְכָּ֣א טָ֗ב יִ֠תְבַּקַּ֠ר בְּבֵ֨ית גִּנְזַיָּ֜א דִּי־מַלְכָּ֣א תַמָּה֮ דִּ֣י בְּבָבֶל֒ הֵ֣ן אִיתַ֗י דִּֽי־מִן־כּ֤וֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּא֙ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵ֔ם לְמִבְנֵ֛א בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֥א דֵ֖ךְ בִּירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וּרְע֥וּת מַלְכָּ֛א עַל־דְּנָ֖ה יִשְׁלַ֥ח עֲלֶֽינָא׃ {פ}
Translated: And now, if it please the king, let the royal archives there in Babylon be searched to see whether indeed an order had been issued by King Cyrus to rebuild this House of God in Jerusalem. May the king convey to us his pleasure in this matter.”
Transliteration: ukhean hen al-malekha tav yitevakar veveyt ginezaya diy-malekha tamah diy vevavel hen iytay diy-min-khvoresh malekha shiym teem lemivene veyt-elaha dekhe viyrushelem ureut malekha al-denah yishelach aleyna {f}

Hebrew: בֵּאדַ֛יִן דָּרְיָ֥וֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֖א שָׂ֣ם טְעֵ֑ם וּבַקַּ֣רוּ ׀ בְּבֵ֣ית סִפְרַיָּ֗א דִּ֧י גִנְזַיָּ֛א מְהַחֲתִ֥ין תַּמָּ֖ה בְּבָבֶֽל׃
Translated: Thereupon, at the order of King Darius, they searched the archives where the treasures were stored in Babylon.
Transliteration: vedayiin dareyavesh malekha sham teem uvakaru veveyt siferaya diy ginezaya mehachatiyn tamah vevavel

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁתְּכַ֣ח בְּאַחְמְתָ֗א בְּבִ֥ירְתָ֛א דִּ֛י בְּמָדַ֥י מְדִינְתָּ֖א מְגִלָּ֣ה חֲדָ֑ה וְכֵן־כְּתִ֥יב בְּגַוַּ֖הּ דִּכְרוֹנָֽהֿ׃ {פ}
Translated: But it was in the citadel of Ecbatana, in the province of Media, that a scroll was found in which the following was written: “Memorandum:
Transliteration: vehishetekhach veachemeta veviyreta diy vemaday mediyneta megilah chadah vekhen-khetiyv vegavah dikhervonahֿ {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת חֲדָ֜ה לְכ֣וֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֗א כּ֣וֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּא֮ שָׂ֣ם טְעֵם֒ בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֤א בִֽירוּשְׁלֶם֙ בַּיְתָ֣א יִתְבְּנֵ֔א אֲתַר֙ דִּֽי־דָבְחִ֣ין דִּבְחִ֔ין וְאֻשּׁ֖וֹהִי מְסֽוֹבְלִ֑ין רוּמֵהּ֙ אַמִּ֣ין שִׁתִּ֔ין פְּתָיֵ֖הּ אַמִּ֥ין שִׁתִּֽין׃
Translated: In the first year of King Cyrus, King Cyrus issued an order concerning the House of God in Jerusalem: ‘Let the house be rebuilt, a place for offering sacrifices, with a base built up high. Let it be sixty cubits high and sixty cubits wide,
Transliteration: vishenat chadah lekhvoresh malekha khvoresh malekha sham teem veyt-elaha viyrushelem vayeta yitevene atar diy-davechiyn divechiyn veushvohiy mesvoveliyn rumeh amiyn shitiyn fetaeih amiyn shitiyn

Hebrew: נִדְבָּכִ֞ין דִּי־אֶ֤בֶן גְּלָל֙ תְּלָתָ֔א וְנִדְבָּ֖ךְ דִּי־אָ֣ע חֲדַ֑ת וְנִ֨פְקְתָ֔א מִן־בֵּ֥ית מַלְכָּ֖א תִּתְיְהִֽב׃ {ס}
Translated: with a course of unused timber for each three courses of hewn stone. The expenses shall be paid by the palace.
Transliteration: nidevakhiyn diy-even gelal telata venidevakhe diy-a chadat venifeketa min-veyt malekha titeyehiv {s}

Hebrew: וְ֠אַ֠ף מָאנֵ֣י בֵית־אֱלָהָא֮ דִּ֣י דַהֲבָ֣ה וְכַסְפָּא֒ דִּ֣י נְבֽוּכַדְנֶצַּ֗ר הַנְפֵּ֛ק מִן־הֵיכְלָ֥א דִי־בִירוּשְׁלֶ֖ם וְהֵיבֵ֣ל לְבָבֶ֑ל יַהֲתִיב֗וּן וִ֠יהָ֠ךְ לְהֵיכְלָ֤א דִי־בִירֽוּשְׁלֶם֙ לְאַתְרֵ֔הּ וְתַחֵ֖ת בְּבֵ֥ית אֱלָהָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: And the gold and silver vessels of the House of God which Nebuchadnezzar had taken away from the temple in Jerusalem and transported to Babylon shall be returned, and let each go back to the temple in Jerusalem where it belongs; you shall deposit it in the House of God.’
Transliteration: veaf maney veyt-elaha diy dahavah vekhasefa diy nevukhadenetsar hanefek min-heykhela diy-viyrushelem veheyvel levavel yahatiyvun viyhakhe leheykhela diy-viyrushelem leatereh vetachet veveyt elaha {s}

Hebrew: כְּעַ֡ן תַּ֠תְּנַ֠י פַּחַ֨ת עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֜ה שְׁתַ֤ר בּוֹזְנַי֙ וּכְנָוָ֣תְה֔וֹן אֲפַ֨רְסְכָיֵ֔א דִּ֖י בַּעֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֑ה רַחִיקִ֥ין הֲו֖וֹ מִן־תַּמָּֽה׃
Translated: “Now you, Tattenai, governor of the province of Beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai and colleagues, the officials of the province of Beyond the River, stay away from that place.
Transliteration: khean tatenay fachat avar-naharah shetar vvozenay ukhenavatehvon afaresekhaei diy vaavar naharah rachiykiyn havvo min-tamah

Hebrew: שְׁבֻ֕קוּ לַעֲבִידַ֖ת בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֣א דֵ֑ךְ פַּחַ֤ת יְהוּדָיֵא֙ וּלְשָׂבֵ֣י יְהוּדָיֵ֔א בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֥א דֵ֖ךְ יִבְנ֥וֹן עַל־אַתְרֵֽהּ׃
Translated: Allow the work of this House of God to go on; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews rebuild this House of God on its site.
Transliteration: shevuku laaviydat veyt-elaha dekhe fachat yehudaei uleshavey yehudaei veyt-elaha dekhe yivenvon al-atereh

Hebrew: וּמִנִּי֮ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵם֒ לְמָ֣א דִֽי־תַֽעַבְד֗וּן עִם־שָׂבֵ֤י יְהוּדָיֵא֙ אִלֵּ֔ךְ לְמִבְנֵ֖א בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֣א דֵ֑ךְ וּמִנִּכְסֵ֣י מַלְכָּ֗א דִּ֚י מִדַּת֙ עֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֔ה אׇסְפַּ֗רְנָא נִפְקְתָ֛א תֶּהֱוֵ֧א מִֽתְיַהֲבָ֛א לְגֻבְרַיָּ֥א אִלֵּ֖ךְ דִּי־לָ֥א לְבַטָּלָֽא׃
Translated: And I hereby issue an order concerning what you must do to help these elders of the Jews rebuild this House of God: the expenses are to be paid to these men with dispatch out of the resources of the king, derived from the taxes of the province of Beyond the River, so that the work not be stopped.
Transliteration: uminiy shiym teem lema diy-taavedun im-shavey yehudaei ilekhe lemivene veyt-elaha dekhe uminikhesey malekha diy midat avar naharah ׇsefarena nifeketa teheve miteyahava leguveraya ilekhe diy-la levatala

Hebrew: וּמָ֣ה חַשְׁחָ֡ן וּבְנֵ֣י תוֹרִ֣ין וְדִכְרִ֣ין וְאִמְּרִ֣ין ׀ לַעֲלָוָ֣ן ׀ לֶאֱלָ֪הּ שְׁמַיָּ֟א חִנְטִ֞ין מְלַ֣ח ׀ חֲמַ֣ר וּמְשַׁ֗ח כְּמֵאמַ֨ר כָּהֲנַיָּ֤א דִי־בִירֽוּשְׁלֶם֙ לֶהֱוֵ֨א מִתְיְהֵ֥ב לְהֹ֛ם י֥וֹם ׀ בְּי֖וֹם דִּי־לָ֥א שָׁלֽוּ׃
Translated: They are to be given daily, without fail, whatever they need of young bulls, rams, or lambs as burnt offerings for the God of Heaven, and wheat, salt, wine, and oil, at the order of the priests in Jerusalem,
Transliteration: umah chashechan uveney tvoriyn vedikheriyn veimeriyn laalavan leelah shemaya chinetiyn melach chamar umeshach khememar khahanaya diy-viyrushelem leheve miteyehev lehom yvom veyvom diy-la shalu

Hebrew: דִּֽי־לֶהֱוֺ֧ן מְהַקְרְבִ֛ין נִיחוֹחִ֖ין לֶאֱלָ֣הּ שְׁמַיָּ֑א וּמְצַלַּ֕יִן לְחַיֵּ֥י מַלְכָּ֖א וּבְנֽוֹהִי׃
Translated: so that they may offer pleasing sacrifices to the God of Heaven and pray for the life of the king and his sons.
Transliteration: diy-lehevon mehakereviyn niychvochiyn leelah shemaya umetsalayiin lechayey malekha uvenvohiy

Hebrew: וּמִנִּי֮ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵם֒ דִּ֣י כׇל־אֱנָ֗שׁ דִּ֤י יְהַשְׁנֵא֙ פִּתְגָמָ֣א דְנָ֔ה יִתְנְסַ֥ח אָע֙ מִן־בַּיְתֵ֔הּ וּזְקִ֖יף יִתְמְחֵ֣א עֲלֹ֑הִי וּבַיְתֵ֛הּ נְוָל֥וּ יִתְעֲבֵ֖ד עַל־דְּנָֽה׃
Translated: I also issue an order that whoever alters this decree shall have a beam removed from his house, and he shall be impaled on it and his house confiscated.
Transliteration: uminiy shiym teem diy khׇl-enash diy yehashene fitegama denah yitenesach a min-vayeteh uzekiyf yitemeche alohiy uvayeteh nevalu yiteaved al-denah

Hebrew: וֵֽאלָהָ֞א דִּ֣י שַׁכִּ֧ן שְׁמֵ֣הּ תַּמָּ֗ה יְמַגַּ֞ר כׇּל־מֶ֤לֶךְ וְעַם֙ דִּ֣י ׀ יִשְׁלַ֣ח יְדֵ֗הּ לְהַשְׁנָיָ֛ה לְחַבָּלָ֛ה בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֥א דֵ֖ךְ דִּ֣י בִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם אֲנָ֤ה דָרְיָ֙וֶשׁ֙ שָׂ֣מֶת טְעֵ֔ם אׇסְפַּ֖רְנָא יִתְעֲבִֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: And may the God who established His name there cause the downfall of any king or nation that undertakes to alter or damage that House of God in Jerusalem. I, Darius, have issued the decree; let it be carried out with dispatch.”
Transliteration: velaha diy shakhin shemeh tamah yemagar khׇl-melekhe veam diy yishelach yedeh lehashenayah lechavalah veyt-elaha dekhe diy viyrushelem anah dareyavesh shamet teem ׇsefarena yiteavid {f}

Hebrew: אֱ֠דַ֠יִן תַּתְּנַ֞י פַּחַ֧ת עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֛ה שְׁתַ֥ר בּוֹזְנַ֖י וּכְנָוָתְה֑וֹן לׇקֳבֵ֗ל דִּֽי־שְׁלַ֞ח דָּרְיָ֧וֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֛א כְּנֵ֖מָא אׇסְפַּ֥רְנָא עֲבַֽדוּ׃
Translated: Then Tattenai, governor of the province of Beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai, and their colleagues carried out with dispatch what King Darius had written.
Transliteration: edayiin tatenay fachat avar-naharah shetar vvozenay ukhenavatehvon lׇkovel diy-shelach dareyavesh malekha khenema ׇsefarena avadu

Hebrew: וְשָׂבֵ֤י יְהוּדָיֵא֙ בָּנַ֣יִן וּמַצְלְחִ֔ין בִּנְבוּאַת֙ חַגַּ֣י (נביאה) [נְבִיָּ֔א] וּזְכַרְיָ֖ה בַּר־עִדּ֑וֹא וּבְנ֣וֹ וְשַׁכְלִ֗לוּ מִן־טַ֙עַם֙ אֱלָ֣הּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמִטְּעֵם֙ כּ֣וֹרֶשׁ וְדָרְיָ֔וֶשׁ וְאַרְתַּחְשַׁ֖שְׂתְּא מֶ֥לֶךְ פָּרָֽס׃
Translated: So the elders of the Jews progressed in the building, urged on by the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah son of Iddo, and they brought the building to completion under the aegis of the God of Israel and by the order of Cyrus and Darius and King Artaxerxes of Persia.
Transliteration: veshavey yehudaei vanayiin umatselechiyn vinevuat chagay (nvyh) [neviya] uzekhareyah var-idvo uvenvo veshakhelilu min-taam elah yisherael umiteem khvoresh vedareyavesh vearetacheshashete melekhe faras

Hebrew: וְשֵׁיצִיא֙ בַּיְתָ֣ה דְנָ֔ה עַ֛ד י֥וֹם תְּלָתָ֖ה לִירַ֣ח אֲדָ֑ר דִּי־הִ֣יא שְׁנַת־שֵׁ֔ת לְמַלְכ֖וּת דָּרְיָ֥וֶשׁ מַלְכָּֽא׃ {פ}
Translated: The house was finished on the third of the month of Adar in the sixth year of the reign of King Darius.
Transliteration: vesheytsiy vayetah denah ad yvom telatah liyrach adar diy-hiy shenat-shet lemalekhut dareyavesh malekha {f}

Hebrew: וַעֲבַ֣דוּ בְנֵֽי־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל כָּהֲנַיָּ֨א וְלֵוָיֵ֜א וּשְׁאָ֣ר בְּנֵי־גָלוּתָ֗א חֲנֻכַּ֛ת בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֥א דְנָ֖ה בְּחֶדְוָֽה׃
Translated: The Israelites, the priests, and the Levites, and all the other exiles celebrated the dedication of the House of God with joy.
Transliteration: vaavadu veney-yisherael khahanaya velevaei ushear veney-galuta chanukhat veyt-elaha denah vechedevah

Hebrew: וְהַקְרִ֗בוּ לַחֲנֻכַּת֮ בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֣א דְנָה֒ תּוֹרִ֣ין מְאָ֔ה דִּכְרִ֣ין מָאתַ֔יִן אִמְּרִ֖ין אַרְבַּ֣ע מְאָ֑ה וּצְפִירֵ֨י עִזִּ֜ין (לחטיא) [לְחַטָּאָ֤ה] עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ תְּרֵֽי־עֲשַׂ֔ר לְמִנְיָ֖ן שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And they sacrificed for the dedication of this House of God one hundred bulls, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs, and twelve goats as a purification offering for all of Israel, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
Transliteration: vehakerivu lachanukhat veyt-elaha denah tvoriyn meah dikheriyn matayiin imeriyn areva meah utsefiyrey iziyn (lchty) [lechataah] al-khׇl-yisherael terey-ashar lemineyan shivetey yisherael

Hebrew: וַהֲקִ֨ימוּ כָהֲנַיָּ֜א בִּפְלֻגָּתְה֗וֹן וְלֵוָיֵא֙ בְּמַחְלְקָ֣תְה֔וֹן עַל־עֲבִידַ֥ת אֱלָהָ֖א דִּ֣י בִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם כִּכְתָ֖ב סְפַ֥ר מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: They appointed the priests in their courses and the Levites in their divisions for the service of God in Jerusalem, according to the prescription in the Book of Moses.
Transliteration: vahakiymu khahanaya vifelugatehvon velevaei vemachelekatehvon al-aviydat elaha diy viyrushelem khikhetav sefar mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ בְנֵי־הַגּוֹלָ֖ה אֶת־הַפָּ֑סַח בְּאַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר לַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָרִאשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated: The returned exiles celebrated the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month,
Transliteration: vayaashu veney-hagvolah et-hafasach vearevaah ashar lachodesh harishvon

Hebrew: כִּ֣י הִֽטַּהֲר֞וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֛ם כְּאֶחָ֖ד כֻּלָּ֣ם טְהוֹרִ֑ים וַיִּשְׁחֲט֤וּ הַפֶּ֙סַח֙ לְכׇל־בְּנֵ֣י הַגּוֹלָ֔ה וְלַאֲחֵיהֶ֥ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְלָהֶֽם׃
Translated: for the priests and Levites had purified themselves to a man; they were all pure. They slaughtered the passover offering for all the returned exiles, and for their brother priests and for themselves.
Transliteration: khiy hitaharu hakhohaniym vehaleviyim kheechad khulam tehvoriym vayishechatu hafesach lekhׇl-veney hagvolah velaacheyhem hakhohaniym velahem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאכְל֣וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הַשָּׁבִים֙ מֵֽהַגּוֹלָ֔ה וְכֹ֗ל הַנִּבְדָּ֛ל מִטֻּמְאַ֥ת גּוֹיֵֽ־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם לִדְרֹ֕שׁ לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The children of Israel who had returned from the exile, together with all who joined them in separating themselves from the uncleanliness of the nations of the lands to worship the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel, ate of it.
Transliteration: vayokhelu veney-yisherael hashaviym mehagvolah vekhol hanivedal mitumeat gvoei-haarets alehem liderosh layhovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֧וּ חַג־מַצּ֛וֹת שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים בְּשִׂמְחָ֑ה כִּ֣י ׀ שִׂמְּחָ֣ם יְהֹוָ֗ה וְֽהֵסֵ֞ב לֵ֤ב מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁוּר֙ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם לְחַזֵּ֣ק יְדֵיהֶ֔ם בִּמְלֶ֥אכֶת בֵּית־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: They joyfully celebrated the Feast of Unleavened Bread for seven days, for the L<small>ORD</small> had given them cause for joy by inclining the heart of the Assyrian king toward them so as to give them support in the work of the House of God, the God of Israel.
Transliteration: vayaashu chag-matsvot shiveat yamiym veshimechah khiy shimecham yehovah vehesev lev melekhe-ashur aleyhem lechazek yedeyhem vimelekhet veyt-haElohim elohey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וְאַחַר֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה בְּמַלְכ֖וּת אַרְתַּחְשַׁ֣סְתְּא מֶֽלֶךְ־פָּרָ֑ס עֶזְרָא֙ בֶּן־שְׂרָיָ֔ה בֶּן־עֲזַרְיָ֖ה בֶּן־חִלְקִיָּֽה׃
Translated: After these events, during the reign of King Artaxerxes of Persia, Ezra son of Seraiah son of Azariah son of Hilkiah
Transliteration: veachar hadevariym haeleh vemalekhut aretacheshasete melekhe-faras ezera ven-sherayah ven-azareyah ven-chilekiyah

Hebrew: בֶּן־שַׁלּ֥וּם בֶּן־צָד֖וֹק בֶּן־אֲחִיטֽוּב׃
Translated: son of Shallum son of Zadok son of Ahitub
Transliteration: ven-shalum ven-tsadvok ven-achiytuv

Hebrew: בֶּן־אֲמַרְיָ֥ה בֶן־עֲזַרְיָ֖ה בֶּן־מְרָיֽוֹת׃
Translated: son of Amariah son of Azariah son of Meraioth
Transliteration: ven-amareyah ven-azareyah ven-merayvot

Hebrew: בֶּן־זְרַֽחְיָ֥ה בֶן־עֻזִּ֖י בֶּן־בֻּקִּֽי׃
Translated: son of Zerahiah son of Uzzi son of Bukki
Transliteration: ven-zeracheyah ven-uziy ven-vukiy

Hebrew: בֶּן־אֲבִישׁ֗וּעַ בֶּן־פִּֽינְחָס֙ בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֔ר בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֥ן הַכֹּהֵ֖ן הָרֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated: son of Abishua son of Phinehas son of Eleazar son of Aaron the chief priest—
Transliteration: ven-aviyshua ven-fiynechas ven-eleazar ven-aharon hakhohen harosh

Hebrew: ה֤וּא עֶזְרָא֙ עָלָ֣ה מִבָּבֶ֔ל וְהֽוּא־סֹפֵ֤ר מָהִיר֙ בְּתוֹרַ֣ת מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּתֶּן־ל֣וֹ הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ כְּיַד־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהָיו֙ עָלָ֔יו כֹּ֖ל בַּקָּשָׁתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: that Ezra came up from Babylon, a scribe expert in the Teaching of Moses which the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel had given, whose request the king had granted in its entirety, thanks to the benevolence of the L<small>ORD</small> toward him.
Transliteration: hu ezera alah mivavel vehu-sofer mahiyr vetvorat mosheh asher-natan yehovah elohey yisherael vayiten-lvo hamelekhe kheyad-yehovah elohayv alayv khol vakashatvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲל֣וּ מִבְּנֵֽי־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל וּמִן־הַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֜ם וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִ֧ים וְהַשֹּׁעֲרִ֛ים וְהַנְּתִינִ֖ים אֶל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם בִּשְׁנַת־שֶׁ֖בַע לְאַרְתַּחְשַׁ֥סְתְּא הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Some of the Israelites, the priests and Levites, the singers, the gatekeepers, and the temple servants set out for Jerusalem in the seventh year of King Artaxerxes,
Transliteration: vayaalu miveney-yisherael umin-hakhohaniym vehaleviyim vehameshoreriym vehashoariym vehanetiyniym el-yerushala͏im vishenat-sheva learetacheshasete hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁ֑י הִ֛יא שְׁנַ֥ת הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖ית לַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: arriving in Jerusalem in the fifth month in the seventh year of the king.)
Transliteration: vayavo yerushala͏im vachodesh hachamiyshiy hiy shenat hasheviyiyt lamelekhe

Hebrew: כִּ֗י בְּאֶחָד֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן ה֣וּא יְסֻ֔ד הַֽמַּעֲלָ֖ה מִבָּבֶ֑ל וּבְאֶחָ֞ד לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁ֗י בָּ֚א אֶל־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם כְּיַד־אֱלֹהָ֖יו הַטּוֹבָ֥ה עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: On the first day of the first month the journey up from Babylon was started, and on the first day of the fifth month he arrived in Jerusalem, thanks to the benevolent care of his God for him.
Transliteration: khiy veechad lachodesh harishvon hu yesud hamaalah mivavel uveechad lachodesh hachamiyshiy va el-yerushala͏im kheyad-elohayv hatvovah alayv

Hebrew: כִּ֤י עֶזְרָא֙ הֵכִ֣ין לְבָב֔וֹ לִדְרֹ֛שׁ אֶת־תּוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלַעֲשֹׂ֑ת וּלְלַמֵּ֥ד בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל חֹ֥ק וּמִשְׁפָּֽט׃ {ס}
Translated: For Ezra had dedicated himself to study the Teaching of the L<small>ORD</small> so as to observe it, and to teach laws and rules to Israel.
Transliteration: khiy ezera hekhiyn levavvo liderosh et-tvorat yehovah velaashot ulelamed veyisherael chok umishefat {s}

Hebrew: וְזֶ֣ה ׀ פַּרְשֶׁ֣גֶן הַֽנִּשְׁתְּוָ֗ן אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָתַן֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אַרְתַּחְשַׁ֔סְתְּא לְעֶזְרָ֥א הַכֹּהֵ֖ן הַסֹּפֵ֑ר סֹפֵ֞ר דִּבְרֵ֧י מִצְוֺת־יְהֹוָ֛ה וְחֻקָּ֖יו עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The following is the text of the letter which King Artaxerxes gave Ezra the priest-scribe, a scholar in matters concerning the commandments of the L<small>ORD</small> and His laws to Israel:
Transliteration: vezeh fareshegen hanishetevan asher natan hamelekhe aretacheshasete leezera hakhohen hasofer sofer diverey mitsevot-yehovah vechukayv al-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: אַ֨רְתַּחְשַׁ֔סְתְּא מֶ֖לֶךְ מַלְכַיָּ֑א לְעֶזְרָ֣א כָ֠הֲנָ֠א סָפַ֨ר דָּתָ֜א דִּֽי־אֱלָ֧הּ שְׁמַיָּ֛א גְּמִ֖יר וּכְעֶֽנֶת׃
Translated: “Artaxerxes king of kings, to Ezra the priest, scholar in the law of the God of heaven, and so forth. And now,
Transliteration: aretacheshasete melekhe malekhaya leezera khahana safar data diy-elah shemaya gemiyr ukheenet

Hebrew: מִנִּי֮ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵם֒ דִּ֣י כׇל־מִתְנַדַּ֣ב בְּמַלְכוּתִי֩ מִן־עַמָּ֨א יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וְכָהֲנ֣וֹהִי וְלֵוָיֵ֗א לִמְהָ֧ךְ לִֽירוּשְׁלֶ֛ם עִמָּ֖ךְ יְהָֽךְ׃
Translated: I hereby issue an order that anyone in my kingdom who is of the people of Israel and its priests and Levites who feels impelled to go to Jerusalem may go with you.
Transliteration: miniy shiym teem diy khׇl-mitenadav vemalekhutiy min-ama yisherael vekhahanvohiy velevaei limehakhe liyrushelem imakhe yehakhe

Hebrew: כׇּל־קֳבֵ֗ל דִּי֩ מִן־קֳדָ֨ם מַלְכָּ֜א וְשִׁבְעַ֤ת יָעֲטֹ֙הִי֙ שְׁלִ֔יחַ לְבַקָּרָ֥ה עַל־יְה֖וּד וְלִֽירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם בְּדָ֥ת אֱלָהָ֖ךְ דִּ֥י בִידָֽךְ׃
Translated: For you are commissioned by the king and his seven advisers to regulate Judah and Jerusalem according to the law of your God, which is in your care,
Transliteration: khׇl-kovel diy min-kodam malekha veshiveat yaatohiy sheliycha levakarah al-yehud veliyrushelem vedat elahakhe diy viydakhe

Hebrew: וּלְהֵיבָלָ֖ה כְּסַ֣ף וּדְהַ֑ב דִּֽי־מַלְכָּ֣א וְיָעֲט֗וֹהִי הִתְנַדַּ֙בוּ֙ לֶאֱלָ֣הּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל דִּ֥י בִֽירוּשְׁלֶ֖ם מִשְׁכְּנֵֽהּ׃
Translated: and to bring the freewill offering of silver and gold, which the king and his advisers made to the God of Israel, whose dwelling is in Jerusalem,
Transliteration: uleheyvalah khesaf udehav diy-malekha veyaatvohiy hitenadavu leelah yisherael diy viyrushelem mishekheneh

Hebrew: וְכֹל֙ כְּסַ֣ף וּדְהַ֔ב דִּ֣י תְהַשְׁכַּ֔ח בְּכֹ֖ל מְדִינַ֣ת בָּבֶ֑ל עִם֩ הִתְנַדָּב֨וּת עַמָּ֤א וְכָֽהֲנַיָּא֙ מִֽתְנַדְּבִ֔ין לְבֵ֥ית אֱלָהֲהֹ֖ם דִּ֥י בִירוּשְׁלֶֽם׃
Translated: and whatever silver and gold that you find throughout the province of Babylon, together with the freewill offerings that the people and the priests will give for the House of their God, which is in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vekhol khesaf udehav diy tehashekhach vekhol mediynat vavel im hitenadavut ama vekhahanaya mitenadeviyn leveyt elahahom diy viyrushelem

Hebrew: כׇּל־קֳבֵ֣ל דְּנָה֩ אׇסְפַּ֨רְנָא תִקְנֵ֜א בְּכַסְפָּ֣א דְנָ֗ה תּוֹרִ֤ין <small>׀</small> דִּכְרִין֙ אִמְּרִ֔ין וּמִנְחָתְה֖וֹן וְנִסְכֵּיה֑וֹן וּתְקָרֵ֣ב הִמּ֔וֹ עַֽל־מַדְבְּחָ֔ה דִּ֛י בֵּ֥ית אֱלָהֲכֹ֖ם דִּ֥י בִירוּשְׁלֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall, therefore, with dispatch acquire with this money bulls, rams, and lambs, with their meal offerings and libations, and offer them on the altar of the House of your God in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khׇl-kovel denah ׇsefarena tikene vekhasefa denah tvoriyn <small></small> dikheriyn imeriyn uminechatehvon venisekheyhvon utekarev himvo al-madevechah diy veyt elahakhom diy viyrushelem

Hebrew: וּמָ֣ה דִי֩ (עליך) [עֲלָ֨ךְ] וְעַל־[אֶחָ֜ךְ] (אחיך) יֵיטַ֗ב בִּשְׁאָ֛ר כַּסְפָּ֥א וְדַהֲבָ֖ה לְמֶעְבַּ֑ד כִּרְע֥וּת אֱלָהֲכֹ֖ם תַּעַבְדֽוּן׃
Translated: And whatever you wish to do with the leftover silver and gold, you and your kinsmen may do, in accord with the will of your God.
Transliteration: umah diy (lykh) [alakhe] veal-[echakhe] (chykh) eiytav vishear khasefa vedahavah lemeevad khireut elahakhom taavedun

Hebrew: וּמָֽאנַיָּא֙ דִּֽי־מִתְיַהֲבִ֣ין לָ֔ךְ לְפׇלְחָ֖ן בֵּ֣ית אֱלָהָ֑ךְ הַשְׁלֵ֕ם קֳדָ֖ם אֱלָ֥הּ יְרוּשְׁלֶֽם׃
Translated: The vessels for the service of the House of your God that are given to you, deliver to God in Jerusalem,
Transliteration: umanaya diy-miteyahaviyn lakhe lefׇlechan veyt elahakhe hashelem kodam elah yerushelem

Hebrew: וּשְׁאָ֗ר חַשְׁחוּת֙ בֵּ֣ית אֱלָהָ֔ךְ דִּ֥י יִפֶּל־לָ֖ךְ לְמִנְתַּ֑ן תִּנְתֵּ֕ן מִן־בֵּ֖ית גִּנְזֵ֥י מַלְכָּֽא׃
Translated: and any other needs of the House of your God that it falls to you to supply, do so from the royal treasury.
Transliteration: ushear chashechut veyt elahakhe diy yifel-lakhe leminetan tineten min-veyt ginezey malekha

Hebrew: וּ֠מִנִּ֠י אֲנָ֞ה אַרְתַּחְשַׁ֤סְתְּא מַלְכָּא֙ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵ֔ם לְכֹל֙ גִּזַּֽבְרַיָּ֔א דִּ֖י בַּעֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֑ה דִּ֣י כׇל־דִּ֣י יִ֠שְׁאֲלֶנְכ֠וֹן עֶזְרָ֨א כָהֲנָ֜א סָפַ֤ר דָּתָא֙ דִּֽי־אֱלָ֣הּ שְׁמַיָּ֔א אׇסְפַּ֖רְנָא יִתְעֲבִֽד׃
Translated: I, King Artaxerxes, for my part, hereby issue an order to all the treasurers in the province of Beyond the River that whatever request Ezra the priest, scholar in the law of the God of Heaven, makes of you is to be fulfilled with dispatch
Transliteration: uminiy anah aretacheshasete malekha shiym teem lekhol gizaveraya diy vaavar naharah diy khׇl-diy yishealenekhvon ezera khahana safar data diy-elah shemaya ׇsefarena yiteavid

Hebrew: עַד־כְּסַף֮ כַּכְּרִ֣ין מְאָה֒ וְעַד־חִנְטִין֙ כּוֹרִ֣ין מְאָ֔ה וְעַד־חֲמַר֙ בַּתִּ֣ין מְאָ֔ה וְעַד־בַּתִּ֥ין מְשַׁ֖ח מְאָ֑ה וּמְלַ֖ח דִּי־לָ֥א כְתָֽב׃
Translated: up to the sum of one hundred talents of silver, one hundred kor of wheat, one hundred bath of wine, one hundred bath of oil, and salt without limit.
Transliteration: ad-khesaf khakheriyn meah vead-chinetiyn khvoriyn meah vead-chamar vatiyn meah vead-vatiyn meshach meah umelach diy-la khetav

Hebrew: כׇּל־דִּ֗י מִן־טַ֙עַם֙ אֱלָ֣הּ שְׁמַיָּ֔א יִתְעֲבֵד֙ אַדְרַזְדָּ֔א לְבֵ֖ית אֱלָ֣הּ שְׁמַיָּ֑א דִּֽי־לְמָ֤ה לֶֽהֱוֵא֙ קְצַ֔ף עַל־מַלְכ֥וּת מַלְכָּ֖א וּבְנֽוֹהִי׃
Translated: Whatever is by order of the God of Heaven must be carried out diligently for the House of the God of Heaven, else wrath will come upon the king and his sons.
Transliteration: khׇl-diy min-taam elah shemaya yiteaved aderazeda leveyt elah shemaya diy-lemah leheve ketsaf al-malekhut malekha uvenvohiy

Hebrew: וּלְכֹ֣ם מְהוֹדְעִ֗ין דִּ֣י כׇל־כָּהֲנַיָּ֣א וְ֠לֵוָיֵ֠א זַמָּ֨רַיָּ֤א תָרָֽעַיָּא֙ נְתִ֣ינַיָּ֔א וּפָ֣לְחֵ֔י בֵּ֖ית אֱלָהָ֣א דְנָ֑ה מִנְדָּ֤ה בְלוֹ֙ וַהֲלָ֔ךְ לָ֥א שַׁלִּ֖יט לְמִרְמֵ֥א עֲלֵיהֹֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: We further advise you that it is not permissible to impose tribute, poll tax, or land tax on any priest, Levite, singer, gatekeeper, temple servant, or other servant of this House of God.
Transliteration: ulekhom mehvodeiyn diy khׇl-khahanaya velevaei zamaraya taraaya netiynaya ufalechey veyt elaha denah minedah velvo vahalakhe la shaliyt lemireme aleyhom {f}

Hebrew: וְאַ֣נְתְּ עֶזְרָ֗א כְּחׇכְמַ֨ת אֱלָהָ֤ךְ דִּֽי־בִידָךְ֙ מֶ֣נִּי שָׁפְטִ֞ין וְדַיָּנִ֗ין דִּי־לֶהֱוֺ֤ן (דאנין) [דָּאיְנִין֙] לְכׇל־עַמָּא֙ דִּ֚י בַּעֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֔ה לְכׇל־יָדְעֵ֖י דָּתֵ֣י אֱלָהָ֑ךְ וְדִ֧י לָ֦א יָדַ֖ע תְּהוֹדְעֽוּן׃
Translated: And you, Ezra, by the divine wisdom you possess, appoint magistrates and judges to judge all the people in the province of Beyond the River who know the laws of your God, and to teach those who do not know them.
Transliteration: veanete ezera khechׇkhemat elahakhe diy-viydakhe meniy shafetiyn vedayaniyn diy-lehevon (dnyn) [dayeniyn] lekhׇl-ama diy vaavar naharah lekhׇl-yadeey datey elahakhe vediy la yada tehvodeun

Hebrew: וְכׇל־דִּי־לָא֩ לֶהֱוֵ֨א עָבֵ֜ד דָּתָ֣א דִֽי־אֱלָהָ֗ךְ וְדָתָא֙ דִּ֣י מַלְכָּ֔א אׇסְפַּ֕רְנָא דִּינָ֕ה לֶהֱוֵ֥א מִתְעֲבֵ֖ד מִנֵּ֑הּ הֵ֤ן לְמוֹת֙ הֵ֣ן (לשרשו) [לִשְׁרֹשִׁ֔י] הֵן־לַעֲנָ֥שׁ נִכְסִ֖ין וְלֶאֱסוּרִֽין׃ {פ}
Translated: Let anyone who does not obey the law of your God and the law of the king be punished with dispatch, whether by death, corporal punishment, confiscation of possessions, or imprisonment.”
Transliteration: vekhׇl-diy-la leheve aved data diy-elahakhe vedata diy malekha ׇsefarena diynah leheve miteaved mineh hen lemvot hen (lshrshv) [lisheroshiy] hen-laanash nikhesiyn veleesuriyn {f}

Hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵ֑ינוּ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֤ן כָּזֹאת֙ בְּלֵ֣ב הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לְפָאֵ֕ר אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Blessed is the L<small>ORD</small> God of our fathers, who put it into the mind of the king to glorify the House of the L<small>ORD</small> in Jerusalem,
Transliteration: varukhe yehovah elohey avoteynu asher natan khazot velev hamelekhe lefaer et-veyt yehovah asher viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וְעָלַ֣י הִטָּה־חֶ֗סֶד לִפְנֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וְיֽוֹעֲצָ֔יו וּלְכׇל־שָׂרֵ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ הַגִּבֹּרִ֑ים וַאֲנִ֣י הִתְחַזַּ֗קְתִּי כְּיַד־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהַי֙ עָלַ֔י וָאֶקְבְּצָ֧ה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֛ל רָאשִׁ֖ים לַעֲל֥וֹת עִמִּֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: and who inclined the king and his counselors and the king’s military officers to be favorably disposed toward me. For my part, thanks to the care of the L<small>ORD</small> for me, I summoned up courage and assembled leading men in Israel to go with me.
Transliteration: vealay hitah-chesed lifeney hamelekhe veyvoatsayv ulekhׇl-sharey hamelekhe hagivoriym vaaniy hitechazaketiy kheyad-yehovah elohay alay vaekevetsah miyisherael rashiym laalvot imiy {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה רָאשֵׁ֥י אֲבֹתֵיהֶ֖ם וְהִתְיַחְשָׂ֑ם הָעֹלִ֣ים עִמִּ֗י בְּמַלְכ֛וּת אַרְתַּחְשַׁ֥סְתְּא הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מִבָּבֶֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: These are the chiefs of the clans and the register of the genealogy of those who came up with me from Babylon in the reign of King Artaxerxes:
Transliteration: veeleh rashey avoteyhem vehiteyachesham haoliym imiy vemalekhut aretacheshasete hamelekhe mivavel {s}

Hebrew: מִבְּנֵ֤י פִֽינְחָס֙ גֵּֽרְשֹׁ֔ם {ס} מִבְּנֵ֥י אִיתָמָ֖ר דָּנִיֵּ֑אל {ס} מִבְּנֵ֥י דָוִ֖יד חַטּֽוּשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: Of the sons of Phinehas, Gershom; of the sons of Ithamar, Daniel; of the sons of David, Hattush.
Transliteration: miveney fiynechas gereshom {s} miveney iytamar daniyel {s} miveney daviyd chatush {s}

Hebrew: מִבְּנֵ֣י שְׁכַנְיָ֔ה {ס} מִבְּנֵ֥י פַרְעֹ֖שׁ זְכַרְיָ֑ה וְעִמּ֛וֹ הִתְיַחֵ֥שׂ לִזְכָרִ֖ים מֵאָ֥ה וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃ {ס}
Translated: Of the sons of Shecaniah: of the sons of Parosh, Zechariah; through him the genealogy of 150 males was registered.
Transliteration: miveney shekhaneyah {s} miveney fareosh zekhareyah veimvo hiteyachesh lizekhariym meah vachamishiym {s}

Hebrew: מִבְּנֵי֙ פַּחַ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב אֶלְיְהֽוֹעֵינַ֖י בֶּן־זְרַֽחְיָ֑ה וְעִמּ֖וֹ מָאתַ֥יִם הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Eliehoenai son of Zerahiah, of the sons of Pahath-moab, and with him 200 males.
Transliteration: miveney fachat mvoav eleyehvoeynay ven-zeracheyah veimvo matayiim hazekhariym {s}

Hebrew: מִבְּנֵ֥י שְׁכַנְיָ֖ה בֶּן־יַחֲזִיאֵ֑ל וְעִמּ֕וֹ שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Of the sons of Shecaniah son of Jahaziel; and with him 300 males.
Transliteration: miveney shekhaneyah ven-yachaziyel veimvo shelosh mevot hazekhariym {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֣י עָדִ֔ין עֶ֖בֶד בֶּן־יוֹנָתָ֑ן וְעִמּ֖וֹ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: And of the sons of Adin, Ebed son of Jonathan; and with him 50 males.
Transliteration: umiveney adiyn eved ven-yvonatan veimvo chamishiym hazekhariym {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֣י עֵילָ֔ם יְשַֽׁעְיָ֖ה בֶּן־עֲתַלְיָ֑ה וְעִמּ֖וֹ שִׁבְעִ֥ים הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: And of the sons of Elam, Jeshaiah son of Athaliah; and with him 70 males.
Transliteration: umiveney eylam yeshaeyah ven-ataleyah veimvo shiveiym hazekhariym {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֣י שְׁפַטְיָ֔ה זְבַדְיָ֖ה בֶּן־מִֽיכָאֵ֑ל וְעִמּ֖וֹ שְׁמֹנִ֥ים הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: And of the sons of Shephatiah, Zebadiah son of Michael; and with him 80 males.
Transliteration: umiveney shefateyah zevadeyah ven-miykhael veimvo shemoniym hazekhariym {s}

Hebrew: מִבְּנֵ֣י יוֹאָ֔ב עֹבַדְיָ֖ה בֶּן־יְחִיאֵ֑ל וְעִמּ֕וֹ מָאתַ֛יִם וּשְׁמֹנָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Of the sons of Joab, Obadiah son of Jehiel; and with him 218 males.
Transliteration: miveney yvoav ovadeyah ven-yechiyel veimvo matayiim ushemonah ashar hazekhariym {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֥י שְׁלוֹמִ֖ית בֶּן־יוֹסִפְיָ֑ה וְעִמּ֕וֹ מֵאָ֥ה וְשִׁשִּׁ֖ים הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: And of the sons of Shelomith, the son of Josiphiah; and with him 160 males.
Transliteration: umiveney shelvomiyt ven-yvosifeyah veimvo meah veshishiym hazekhariym {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֣י בֵבַ֔י זְכַרְיָ֖ה בֶּן־בֵּבָ֑י וְעִמּ֕וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָ֖ה הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: And of the sons of Bebai, Zechariah son of Bebai; and with him 28 males.
Transliteration: umiveney vevay zekhareyah ven-vevay veimvo esheriym ushemonah hazekhariym {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֣י עַזְגָּ֔ד יוֹחָנָ֖ן בֶּן־הַקָּטָ֑ן וְעִמּ֕וֹ מֵאָ֥ה וַעֲשָׂרָ֖ה הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: And of the sons of Azgad, Johanan son of Hakkatan; and with him 110 males.
Transliteration: umiveney azegad yvochanan ven-hakatan veimvo meah vaasharah hazekhariym {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֣י אֲדֹנִיקָם֮ אַחֲרֹנִים֒ וְאֵ֣לֶּה שְׁמוֹתָ֔ם אֱלִיפֶ֖לֶט יְעִיאֵ֣ל וּֽשְׁמַעְיָ֑ה וְעִמָּהֶ֖ם שִׁשִּׁ֥ים הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: And of the sons of Adonikam, who were the last; and these are their names: Eliphelet, Jeiel, and Shemaiah; and with them 60 males.
Transliteration: umiveney adoniykam acharoniym veeleh shemvotam eliyfelet yeiyel ushemaeyah veimahem shishiym hazekhariym {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֥י בִגְוַ֖י עוּתַ֣י (וזבוד) [וְזַכּ֑וּר] וְעִמּ֖וֹ שִׁבְעִ֥ים הַזְּכָרִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: And of the sons of Bigvai, Uthai and Zaccur; and with them 70 males.
Transliteration: umiveney vigevay utay (vzvvd) [vezakhur] veimvo shiveiym hazekhariym {f}

Hebrew: וָֽאֶקְבְּצֵ֗ם אֶל־הַנָּהָר֙ הַבָּ֣א אֶֽל־אַהֲוָ֔א וַנַּחֲנֶ֥ה שָׁ֖ם יָמִ֣ים שְׁלֹשָׁ֑ה וָאָבִ֤ינָה בָעָם֙ וּבַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים וּמִבְּנֵ֥י לֵוִ֖י לֹא־מָצָ֥אתִי שָֽׁם׃
Translated: These I assembled by the river that enters Ahava, and we encamped there for three days. I reviewed the people and the priests, but I did not find any Levites there.
Transliteration: vaekevetsem el-hanahar hava el-ahava vanachaneh sham yamiym sheloshah vaaviynah vaam uvakhohaniym umiveney leviy lo-matsatiy sham
