Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁלְחָ֡ה לֶאֱלִיעֶ֡זֶר לַאֲרִיאֵ֡ל לִֽ֠שְׁמַעְיָ֠ה וּלְאֶלְנָתָ֨ן וּלְיָרִ֜יב וּלְאֶלְנָתָ֧ן וּלְנָתָ֛ן וְלִזְכַרְיָ֥ה וְלִמְשֻׁלָּ֖ם רָאשִׁ֑ים וּלְיוֹיָרִ֥יב וּלְאֶלְנָתָ֖ן מְבִינִֽים׃
Translated: I sent for Eliezer, Ariel, Shemaiah, Elnathan, Jarib, Elnathan, Nathan, Zechariah, and Meshullam, the leading men, and also for Joiarib and Elnathan, the instructors,
Transliteration: vaeshelechah leeliyezer laariyel lishemaeyah uleelenatan uleyariyv uleelenatan ulenatan velizekhareyah velimeshulam rashiym uleyvoyariyv uleelenatan meviyniym

Hebrew: (ואוצאה) [וָאֲצַוֶּ֤ה] אוֹתָם֙ עַל־אִדּ֣וֹ הָרֹ֔אשׁ בְּכָסִפְיָ֖א הַמָּק֑וֹם וָאָשִׂ֩ימָה֩ בְּפִיהֶ֨ם דְּבָרִ֜ים לְ֠דַבֵּ֠ר אֶל־אִדּ֨וֹ אָחִ֤יו (הנתונים) [הַנְּתִינִים֙] בְּכָסִפְיָ֣א הַמָּק֔וֹם לְהָֽבִיא־לָ֥נוּ מְשָׁרְתִ֖ים לְבֵ֥ית אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: and I gave them an order for Iddo, the leader at the place [called] Casiphia. I gave them a message to convey to Iddo [and] his brother, temple-servants at the place [called] Casiphia, that they should bring us attendants for the House of our God.
Transliteration: (vvtsh) [vaatsaveh] votam al-idvo harosh vekhasifeya hamakvom vaashiymah vefiyhem devariym ledaver el-idvo achiyv (hntvnym) [hanetiyniym] vekhasifeya hamakvom lehaviy-lanu mesharetiym leveyt eloheynu

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֨יאּוּ לָ֜נוּ כְּיַד־אֱלֹהֵ֨ינוּ הַטּוֹבָ֤ה עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ שֶׂ֔כֶל {ס} מִבְּנֵ֣י מַחְלִ֔י בֶּן־לֵוִ֖י בֶּן־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְשֵׁרֵ֥בְיָ֛ה וּבָנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁמֹנָ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃
Translated: Thanks to the benevolent care of our God for us, they brought us a capable man of the family of Mahli son of Levi son of Israel, and Sherebiah and his sons and brothers, 18 in all,
Transliteration: vayaviyu lanu kheyad-eloheynu hatvovah aleynu iysh shekhel {s} miveney macheliy ven-leviy ven-yisherael veshereveyah uvanayv veechayv shemonah ashar

Hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־חֲשַׁבְיָ֔ה וְאִתּ֥וֹ יְשַֽׁעְיָ֖ה מִבְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֑י אֶחָ֥יו וּבְנֵיהֶ֖ם עֶשְׂרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: and Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the family of Merari, his brothers and their sons, 20 in all;
Transliteration: veet-chashaveyah veitvo yeshaeyah miveney merariy echayv uveneyhem esheriym {s}

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַנְּתִינִ֗ים שֶׁנָּתַ֨ן דָּוִ֤יד וְהַשָּׂרִים֙ לַעֲבֹדַ֣ת הַלְוִיִּ֔ם נְתִינִ֖ים מָאתַ֣יִם וְעֶשְׂרִ֑ים כֻּלָּ֖ם נִקְּב֥וּ בְשֵׁמֽוֹת׃
Translated: and of the temple servants whom David and the officers had appointed for the service of the Levites—220 temple servants, all of them listed by name.
Transliteration: umin-hanetiyniym shenatan daviyd vehashariym laavodat haleviyim netiyniym matayiim veesheriym khulam nikevu veshemvot

Hebrew: וָאֶקְרָ֨א שָׁ֥ם צוֹם֙ עַל־הַנָּהָ֣ר אַהֲוָ֔א לְהִתְעַנּ֖וֹת לִפְנֵ֣י אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ לְבַקֵּ֤שׁ מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יְשָׁרָ֔ה לָ֥נוּ וּלְטַפֵּ֖נוּ וּלְכׇל־רְכוּשֵֽׁנוּ׃
Translated: I proclaimed a fast there by the Ahava River to afflict ourselves before our God to beseech Him for a smooth journey for us and for our children and for all our possessions;
Transliteration: vaekera sham tsvom al-hanahar ahava lehiteanvot lifeney eloheynu levakesh mimenu derekhe yesharah lanu uletafenu ulekhׇl-rekhushenu

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בֹ֗שְׁתִּי לִשְׁא֤וֹל מִן־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ חַ֣יִל וּפָרָשִׁ֔ים לְעׇזְרֵ֥נוּ מֵאוֹיֵ֖ב בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ כִּֽי־אָמַ֨רְנוּ לַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לֵאמֹ֗ר יַד־אֱלֹהֵ֤ינוּ עַל־כׇּל־מְבַקְשָׁיו֙ לְטוֹבָ֔ה וְעֻזּ֣וֹ וְאַפּ֔וֹ עַ֖ל כׇּל־עֹזְבָֽיו׃
Translated: for I was ashamed to ask the king for soldiers and horsemen to protect us against any enemy on the way, since we had told the king, “The benevolent care of our God is for all who seek Him, while His fierce anger is against all who forsake Him.”
Transliteration: khiy voshetiy lishevol min-hamelekhe chayiil ufarashiym leׇzerenu mevoeiv vadarekhe khiy-amarenu lamelekhe lemor yad-eloheynu al-khׇl-mevakeshayv letvovah veuzvo veafvo al khׇl-ozevayv

Hebrew: וַנָּצ֛וּמָה וַנְּבַקְשָׁ֥ה מֵאֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ עַל־זֹ֑את וַיֵּעָתֵ֖ר לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: So we fasted and besought our God for this, and He responded to our plea.
Transliteration: vanatsumah vanevakeshah meeloheynu al-zot vayeater lanu

Hebrew: וָאַבְדִּ֛ילָה מִשָּׂרֵ֥י הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֑ר לְשֵׁרֵֽבְיָ֣ה חֲשַׁבְיָ֔ה וְעִמָּהֶ֥ם מֵאֲחֵיהֶ֖ם עֲשָׂרָֽה׃
Translated: Then I selected twelve of the chiefs of the priests, namely Sherebiah and Hashabiah with ten of their brothers,
Transliteration: vaavediylah misharey hakhohaniym sheneym ashar leshereveyah chashaveyah veimahem meacheyhem asharah

Hebrew: (ואשקולה) [וָאֶשְׁקֳלָ֣ה] לָהֶ֔ם אֶת־הַכֶּ֥סֶף וְאֶת־הַזָּהָ֖ב וְאֶת־הַכֵּלִ֑ים תְּרוּמַ֣ת בֵּית־אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ הַהֵרִ֙ימוּ֙ הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וְיֹעֲצָ֣יו וְשָׂרָ֔יו וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הַנִּמְצָאִֽים׃
Translated: and I weighed out to them the silver, the gold, and the vessels, the contribution to the House of our God which the king, his counselors and officers, and all Israel who were present had made.
Transliteration: (vshkvlh) [vaeshekolah] lahem et-hakhesef veet-hazahav veet-hakheliym terumat veyt-eloheynu haheriymu hamelekhe veyoatsayv vesharayv vekhׇl-yisherael hanimetsaiym

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁקְלָ֨ה עַל־יָדָ֜ם כֶּ֗סֶף כִּכָּרִים֙ שֵֽׁשׁ־מֵא֣וֹת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֔ים וּכְלֵי־כֶ֥סֶף מֵאָ֖ה לְכִכָּרִ֑ים זָהָ֖ב מֵאָ֥ה כִכָּֽר׃
Translated: I entrusted to their safekeeping the weight of six hundred and fifty talents of silver, one hundred silver vessels of one talent each, one hundred talents of gold;
Transliteration: vaeshekelah al-yadam khesef khikhariym shesh-mevot vachamishiym ukheley-khesef meah lekhikhariym zahav meah khikhar

Hebrew: וּכְפֹרֵ֤י זָהָב֙ עֶשְׂרִ֔ים לַאֲדַרְכֹנִ֖ים אָ֑לֶף וּכְלֵ֨י נְחֹ֜שֶׁת מֻצְהָ֤ב טוֹבָה֙ שְׁנַ֔יִם חֲמוּדֹ֖ת כַּזָּהָֽב׃
Translated: also, twenty gold bowls worth one thousand darics and two vessels of good, shining bronze, as precious as gold.
Transliteration: ukheforey zahav esheriym laadarekhoniym alef ukheley nechoshet mutsehav tvovah shenayiim chamudot khazahav

Hebrew: וָאֹמְרָ֣ה אֲלֵהֶ֗ם אַתֶּ֥ם קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה וְהַכֵּלִ֖ים קֹ֑דֶשׁ וְהַכֶּ֤סֶף וְהַזָּהָב֙ נְדָבָ֔ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I said to them, “You are consecrated to the L<small>ORD</small>, and the vessels are consecrated, and the silver and gold are a freewill offering to the L<small>ORD</small> God of your fathers.
Transliteration: vaomerah alehem atem kodesh layhovah vehakheliym kodesh vehakhesef vehazahav nedavah layhovah elohey avoteykhem

Hebrew: שִׁקְד֣וּ וְשִׁמְר֗וּ עַֽד־תִּשְׁקְל֡וּ לִפְנֵי֩ שָׂרֵ֨י הַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֛ם וְשָׂרֵֽי־הָאָב֥וֹת לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם הַלִּשְׁכ֖וֹת בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Guard them diligently until such time as you weigh them out in the presence of the officers of the priests and the Levites and the officers of the clans of Israel in Jerusalem in the chambers of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.”
Transliteration: shikedu veshimeru ad-tishekelu lifeney sharey hakhohaniym vehaleviyim vesharey-haavvot leyisherael viyrushala͏im halishekhvot veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְקִבְּלוּ֙ הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֔ם מִשְׁקַ֛ל הַכֶּ֥סֶף וְהַזָּהָ֖ב וְהַכֵּלִ֑ים לְהָבִ֥יא לִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם לְבֵ֥ית אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: So the priests and the Levites received the cargo of silver and gold and vessels by weight, to bring them to Jerusalem to the House of our God.
Transliteration: vekivelu hakhohaniym vehaleviyim mishekal hakhesef vehazahav vehakheliym lehaviy liyrushala͏im leveyt eloheynu {f}

Hebrew: וַֽנִּסְּעָ֞ה מִנְּהַ֣ר אַֽהֲוָ֗א בִּשְׁנֵ֤ים עָשָׂר֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן לָלֶ֖כֶת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְיַד־אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ הָיְתָ֣ה עָלֵ֔ינוּ וַיַּ֨צִּילֵ֔נוּ מִכַּ֥ף אוֹיֵ֛ב וְאוֹרֵ֖ב עַל־הַדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: We set out for Jerusalem from the Ahava River on the twelfth of the first month. We enjoyed the care of our God, who saved us from enemy ambush on the journey.
Transliteration: vaniseah minehar ahava visheneym ashar lachodesh harishvon lalekhet yerushala͏im veyad-eloheynu hayetah aleynu vayatsiylenu mikhaf voeiv vevorev al-hadarekhe

Hebrew: וַנָּב֖וֹא יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַנֵּ֥שֶׁב שָׁ֖ם יָמִ֥ים שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: We arrived in Jerusalem and stayed there three days.
Transliteration: vanavvo yerushala͏im vaneshev sham yamiym sheloshah

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הָרְבִיעִ֡י נִשְׁקַ֣ל הַכֶּ֩סֶף֩ וְהַזָּהָ֨ב וְהַכֵּלִ֜ים בְּבֵ֣ית אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ עַ֠ל יַד־מְרֵמ֤וֹת בֶּן־אֽוּרִיָּה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְעִמּ֖וֹ אֶלְעָזָ֣ר בֶּן־פִּֽינְחָ֑ס וְעִמָּהֶ֞ם יוֹזָבָ֧ד בֶּן־יֵשׁ֛וּעַ וְנֽוֹעַדְיָ֥ה בֶן־בִּנּ֖וּי הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: On the fourth day the silver, gold, and vessels were weighed out in the House of our God into the keeping of Meremoth son of Uriah the priest, with whom was Eleazar son of Phinehas. Jozabad son of Jeshua, and Noadiah son of Binnui, the Levites, were with them.
Transliteration: uvayyvom hareviyiy nishekal hakhesef vehazahav vehakheliym veveyt eloheynu al yad-meremvot ven-uriyah hakhohen veimvo eleazar ven-fiynechas veimahem yvozavad ven-eishua venvoadeyah ven-vinuy haleviyim

Hebrew: בְּמִסְפָּ֥ר בְּמִשְׁקָ֖ל לַכֹּ֑ל וַיִּכָּתֵ֥ב כׇּֽל־הַמִּשְׁקָ֖ל בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִֽיא׃ {פ}
Translated: Everything accorded as to number and weight, the entire cargo being recorded at that time.
Transliteration: vemisefar vemishekal lakhol vayikhatev khׇl-hamishekal vaet hahiy {f}

Hebrew: הַ֠בָּאִ֠ים מֵֽהַשְּׁבִ֨י בְנֵֽי־הַגּוֹלָ֜ה הִקְרִ֥יבוּ עֹל֣וֹת ׀ לֵאלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל פָּרִ֨ים שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֤ר עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֵילִ֣ים ׀ תִּשְׁעִ֣ים וְשִׁשָּׁ֗ה כְּבָשִׂים֙ שִׁבְעִ֣ים וְשִׁבְעָ֔ה צְפִירֵ֥י חַטָּ֖את שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֑ר הַכֹּ֖ל עוֹלָ֥ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The returning exiles who arrived from captivity made burnt offerings to the God of Israel: twelve bulls for all Israel, ninety-six rams, seventy-seven lambs and twelve he-goats as a purification offering, all this a burnt offering to the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: havaiym mehasheviy veney-hagvolah hikeriyvu olvot lelohey yisherael fariym sheneym-ashar al-khׇl-yisherael eyliym tisheiym veshishah khevashiym shiveiym veshiveah tsefiyrey chatat sheneym ashar hakhol volah layhovah {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנ֣וּ ׀ אֶת־דָּתֵ֣י הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ לַאֲחַשְׁדַּרְפְּנֵי֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וּפַחֲו֖וֹת עֵ֣בֶר הַנָּהָ֑ר וְנִשְּׂא֥וּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: They handed the royal orders to the king’s satraps and the governors of the province of Beyond the River who gave support to the people and the House of God.
Transliteration: vayitenu et-datey hamelekhe laachashedarefeney hamelekhe ufachavvot ever hanahar venisheu et-haam veet-veyt haElohim {s}

Hebrew: וּכְכַלּ֣וֹת אֵ֗לֶּה נִגְּשׁ֨וּ אֵלַ֤י הַשָּׂרִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹֽא־נִבְדְּל֞וּ הָעָ֤ם יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֔ם מֵעַמֵּ֖י הָאֲרָצ֑וֹת כְּ֠תֹעֲבֹֽתֵיהֶ֠ם לַכְּנַעֲנִ֨י הַחִתִּ֜י הַפְּרִזִּ֣י הַיְבוּסִ֗י הָֽעַמֹּנִי֙ הַמֹּ֣אָבִ֔י הַמִּצְרִ֖י וְהָאֱמֹרִֽי׃
Translated: When this was over, the officers approached me, saying, “The people of Israel and the priests and Levites have not separated themselves from the peoples of the land whose abhorrent practices are like those of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites.
Transliteration: ukhekhalvot eleh nigeshu elay hashariym lemor lo-nivedelu haam yisherael vehakhohaniym vehaleviyim meamey haaratsvot khetoavoteyhem lakhenaaniy hachitiy haferiziy hayevusiy haamoniy hamoaviy hamitseriy vehaemoriy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־נָשְׂא֣וּ מִבְּנֹֽתֵיהֶ֗ם לָהֶם֙ וְלִבְנֵיהֶ֔ם וְהִתְעָֽרְבוּ֙ זֶ֣רַע הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ בְּעַמֵּ֖י הָאֲרָצ֑וֹת וְיַ֧ד הַשָּׂרִ֣ים וְהַסְּגָנִ֗ים הָ֥יְתָ֛ה בַּמַּ֥עַל הַזֶּ֖ה רִאשׁוֹנָֽה׃
Translated: They have taken their daughters as wives for themselves and for their sons, so that the holy seed has become intermingled with the peoples of the land; and it is the officers and prefects who have taken the lead in this trespass.”
Transliteration: khiy-nasheu mivenoteyhem lahem veliveneyhem vehitearevu zera hakodesh veamey haaratsvot veyad hashariym vehaseganiym hayetah vamaal hazeh rishvonah

Hebrew: וּכְשׇׁמְעִי֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה קָרַ֥עְתִּי אֶת־בִּגְדִ֖י וּמְעִילִ֑י וָאֶמְרְטָ֞ה מִשְּׂעַ֤ר רֹאשִׁי֙ וּזְקָנִ֔י וָאֵשְׁבָ֖ה מְשׁוֹמֵֽם׃
Translated: When I heard this, I rent my garment and robe, I tore hair out of my head and beard, and I sat desolate.
Transliteration: ukheshׇmeiy et-hadavar hazeh karaetiy et-vigediy umeiyliy vaemeretah mishear roshiy uzekaniy vaeshevah meshvomem

Hebrew: וְאֵלַ֣י יֵאָסְפ֗וּ כֹּ֚ל חָרֵד֙ בְּדִבְרֵ֣י אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֖ל מַ֣עַל הַגּוֹלָ֑ה וַאֲנִי֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב מְשׁוֹמֵ֔ם עַ֖ד לְמִנְחַ֥ת הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Around me gathered all who were concerned over the words of the God of Israel because of the returning exiles’ trespass, while I sat desolate until the evening offering.
Transliteration: veelay eiasefu khol chared vediverey elohey-yisherael al maal hagvolah vaaniy yoshev meshvomem ad leminechat haarev

Hebrew: וּבְמִנְחַ֣ת הָעֶ֗רֶב קַ֚מְתִּי מִתַּֽעֲנִיתִ֔י וּבְקׇרְעִ֥י בִגְדִ֖י וּמְעִילִ֑י וָֽאֶכְרְעָה֙ עַל־בִּרְכַּ֔י וָאֶפְרְשָׂ֥ה כַפַּ֖י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated: At the time of the evening offering I ended my self-affliction; still in my torn garment and robe, I got down on my knees and spread out my hands to the L<small>ORD</small> my God,
Transliteration: uveminechat haerev kametiy mitaaniytiy uvekׇreiy vigediy umeiyliy vaekhereah al-virekhay vaefereshah khafay el-yehovah elohay

Hebrew: וָאֹמְרָ֗ה אֱלֹהַי֙ בֹּ֣שְׁתִּי וְנִכְלַ֔מְתִּי לְהָרִ֧ים אֱלֹהַ֛י פָּנַ֖י אֵלֶ֑יךָ כִּ֣י עֲוֺנֹתֵ֤ינוּ רָבוּ֙ לְמַ֣עְלָה רֹּ֔אשׁ וְאַשְׁמָתֵ֥נוּ גָדְלָ֖ה עַ֥ד לַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: and said, “O my God, I am too ashamed and mortified to lift my face to You, O my God, for our iniquities are overwhelming and our guilt has grown high as heaven.
Transliteration: vaomerah elohay voshetiy venikhelametiy lehariym elohay fanay eleykha khiy avonoteynu ravu lemaelah rosh veashematenu gadelah ad lashamayiim

Hebrew: מִימֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵ֗ינוּ אֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ בְּאַשְׁמָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וּבַעֲוֺנֹתֵ֡ינוּ נִתַּ֡נּוּ אֲנַ֩חְנוּ֩ מְלָכֵ֨ינוּ כֹהֲנֵ֜ינוּ בְּיַ֣ד ׀ מַלְכֵ֣י הָאֲרָצ֗וֹת בַּחֶ֜רֶב בַּשְּׁבִ֧י וּבַבִּזָּ֛ה וּבְבֹ֥שֶׁת פָּנִ֖ים כְּהַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: From the time of our fathers to this very day we have been deep in guilt. Because of our iniquities, we, our kings, and our priests have been handed over to foreign kings, to the sword, to captivity, to pillage, and to humiliation, as is now the case.
Transliteration: miymey avoteynu anachenu veashemah gedolah ad hayyvom hazeh uvaavonoteynu nitanu anachenu melakheynu khohaneynu veyad malekhey haaratsvot vacherev vasheviy uvavizah uvevoshet faniym khehayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה כִּמְעַט־רֶ֩גַע֩ הָיְתָ֨ה תְחִנָּ֜ה מֵאֵ֣ת ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ לְהַשְׁאִ֥יר לָ֙נוּ֙ פְּלֵיטָ֔ה וְלָתֶת־לָ֥נוּ יָתֵ֖ד בִּמְק֣וֹם קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ לְהָאִ֤יר עֵינֵ֙ינוּ֙ אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ וּלְתִתֵּ֛נוּ מִֽחְיָ֥ה מְעַ֖ט בְּעַבְדֻתֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: “But now, for a short while, there has been a reprieve from the L<small>ORD</small> our God, who has granted us a surviving remnant and given us a stake in His holy place; our God has restored the luster to our eyes and furnished us with a little sustenance in our bondage.
Transliteration: veatah khimeat-rega hayetah techinah meet yehovah eloheynu lehasheiyr lanu feleytah velatet-lanu yated vimekvom kׇdeshvo lehaiyr eyneynu eloheynu uletitenu micheyah meat veavedutenu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עֲבָדִ֣ים אֲנַ֔חְנוּ וּ֨בְעַבְדֻתֵ֔נוּ לֹ֥א עֲזָבָ֖נוּ אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַֽיַּט־עָלֵ֣ינוּ חֶ֡סֶד לִפְנֵי֩ מַלְכֵ֨י פָרַ֜ס לָֽתֶת־לָ֣נוּ מִֽחְיָ֗ה לְרוֹמֵ֞ם אֶת־בֵּ֤ית אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ וּלְהַעֲמִ֣יד אֶת־חׇרְבֹתָ֔יו וְלָֽתֶת־לָ֣נוּ גָדֵ֔ר בִּֽיהוּדָ֖ה וּבִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: For bondsmen we are, though even in our bondage God has not forsaken us, but has disposed the king of Persia favorably toward us, to furnish us with sustenance and to raise again the House of our God, repairing its ruins and giving us a hold in Judah and Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khiy-avadiym anachenu uveavedutenu lo azavanu eloheynu vayat-aleynu chesed lifeney malekhey faras latet-lanu micheyah lervomem et-veyt eloheynu ulehaamiyd et-chׇrevotayv velatet-lanu gader viyhudah uviyrushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֛ה מַה־נֹּאמַ֥ר אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ אַֽחֲרֵי־זֹ֑את כִּ֥י עָזַ֖בְנוּ מִצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: “Now, what can we say in the face of this, O our God, for we have forsaken Your commandments,
Transliteration: veatah mah-nomar eloheynu acharey-zot khiy azavenu mitsevoteykha

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּ֗יתָ בְּיַ֨ד עֲבָדֶ֣יךָ הַנְּבִיאִים֮ לֵאמֹר֒ הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֤ם בָּאִים֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ אֶ֤רֶץ נִדָּה֙ הִ֔יא בְּנִדַּ֖ת עַמֵּ֣י הָאֲרָצ֑וֹת בְּתוֹעֲבֹֽתֵיהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִלְא֛וּהָ מִפֶּ֥ה אֶל־פֶּ֖ה בְּטֻמְאָתָֽם׃
Translated: which You gave us through Your servants the prophets when You said, ‘The land that you are about to possess is a land unclean through the uncleanness of the peoples of the land, through their abhorrent practices with which they, in their impurity, have filled it from one end to the other.
Transliteration: asher tsiviyta veyad avadeykha haneviyiym lemor haarets asher atem vaiym lerishetah erets nidah hiy venidat amey haaratsvot vetvoavoteyhem asher mileuha mifeh el-feh vetumeatam

Hebrew: וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה בְּֽנוֹתֵיכֶ֞ם אַל־תִּתְּנ֣וּ לִבְנֵיהֶ֗ם וּבְנֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ אַל־תִּשְׂא֣וּ לִבְנֵיכֶ֔ם וְלֹֽא־תִדְרְשׁ֧וּ שְׁלֹמָ֛ם וְטוֹבָתָ֖ם עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם לְמַ֣עַן תֶּחֶזְק֗וּ וַאֲכַלְתֶּם֙ אֶת־ט֣וּב הָאָ֔רֶץ וְהוֹרַשְׁתֶּ֥ם לִבְנֵיכֶ֖ם עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Now then, do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons or let their daughters marry your sons; do nothing for their well-being or advantage, then you will be strong and enjoy the bounty of the land and bequeath it to your children forever.’
Transliteration: veatah venvoteykhem al-titenu liveneyhem uvenoteyhem al-tisheu liveneykhem velo-tidereshu shelomam vetvovatam ad-volam lemaan techezeku vaakhaletem et-tuv haarets vehvorashetem liveneykhem ad-volam

Hebrew: וְאַֽחֲרֵי֙ כׇּל־הַבָּ֣א עָלֵ֔ינוּ בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֙ינוּ֙ הָרָעִ֔ים וּבְאַשְׁמָתֵ֖נוּ הַגְּדֹלָ֑ה כִּ֣י ׀ אַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ חָשַׂ֤כְתָּֽ לְמַ֙טָּה֙ מֵֽעֲוֺנֵ֔נוּ וְנָתַ֥תָּה לָּ֛נוּ פְּלֵיטָ֖ה כָּזֹֽאת׃
Translated: After all that has happened to us because of our evil deeds and our deep guilt—though You, our God, have been forbearing, [punishing us] less than our iniquity [deserves] in that You have granted us such a remnant as this—
Transliteration: veacharey khׇl-hava aleynu vemaasheynu haraiym uveashematenu hagedolah khiy atah eloheynu chashakheta lematah meavonenu venatatah lanu feleytah khazot

Hebrew: הֲנָשׁוּב֙ לְהָפֵ֣ר מִצְוֺתֶ֔יךָ וּ֨לְהִתְחַתֵּ֔ן בְּעַמֵּ֥י הַתֹּעֵב֖וֹת הָאֵ֑לֶּה הֲל֤וֹא תֶֽאֱנַף־בָּ֙נוּ֙ עַד־כַּלֵּ֔ה לְאֵ֥ין שְׁאֵרִ֖ית וּפְלֵיטָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: shall we once again violate Your commandments by intermarrying with these peoples who follow such abhorrent practices? Will You not rage against us till we are destroyed without remnant or survivor?
Transliteration: hanashuv lehafer mitsevoteykha ulehitechaten veamey hatoevvot haeleh halvo teenaf-vanu ad-khaleh leeyn sheeriyt ufeleytah {s}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ צַדִּ֣יק אַ֔תָּה כִּֽי־נִשְׁאַ֥רְנוּ פְלֵיטָ֖ה כְּהַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה הִנְנ֤וּ לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ בְּאַשְׁמָתֵ֔ינוּ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין לַעֲמ֛וֹד לְפָנֶ֖יךָ עַל־זֹֽאת׃ {פ}
Translated: O L<small>ORD</small>, God of Israel, You are benevolent, for we have survived as a remnant, as is now the case. We stand before You in all our guilt, for we cannot face You on this account.”
Transliteration: yehovah elohey yisherael tsadiyk atah khiy-nishearenu feleytah khehayyvom hazeh hinenu lefaneykha veashemateynu khiy eyn laamvod lefaneykha al-zot {f}

Hebrew: וּכְהִתְפַּלֵּ֤ל עֶזְרָא֙ וּכְהִתְוַדֹּת֔וֹ בֹּכֶה֙ וּמִתְנַפֵּ֔ל לִפְנֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים נִקְבְּצוּ֩ אֵלָ֨יו מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֜ל קָהָ֣ל רַב־מְאֹ֗ד אֲנָשִׁ֤ים וְנָשִׁים֙ וִֽילָדִ֔ים כִּֽי־בָכ֥וּ הָעָ֖ם הַרְבֵּה־בֶֽכֶה׃ {פ}
Translated: While Ezra was praying and making confession, weeping and prostrating himself before the House of God, a very great crowd of Israelites gathered about him, men, women, and children; the people were weeping bitterly.
Transliteration: ukhehitefalel ezera ukhehitevadotvo vokheh umitenafel lifeney veyt haElohim nikevetsu elayv miyisherael kahal rav-meod anashiym venashiym viyladiym khiy-vakhu haam hareveh-vekheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַן֩ שְׁכַנְיָ֨ה בֶן־יְחִיאֵ֜ל מִבְּנֵ֤י (עולם) [עֵילָם֙] וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְעֶזְרָ֔א אֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ מָעַ֣לְנוּ בֵאלֹהֵ֔ינוּ וַנֹּ֛שֶׁב נָשִׁ֥ים נׇכְרִיּ֖וֹת מֵעַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וְעַתָּ֛ה יֵשׁ־מִקְוֶ֥ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַל־זֹֽאת׃
Translated: Then Shecaniah son of Jehiel of the family of Elam spoke up and said to Ezra, “We have trespassed against our God by bringing into our homes foreign women from the peoples of the land; but there is still hope for Israel despite this.
Transliteration: vayaan shekhaneyah ven-yechiyel miveney (vlm) [eylam] vayomer leezera anachenu maalenu veloheynu vanoshev nashiym nׇkheriyyvot meamey haarets veatah eish-mikeveh leyisherael al-zot

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה נִֽכְרׇת־בְּרִ֣ית לֵ֠אלֹהֵ֠ינוּ לְהוֹצִ֨יא כׇל־נָשִׁ֜ים וְהַנּוֹלָ֤ד מֵהֶם֙ בַּעֲצַ֣ת אֲדֹנָ֔י וְהַחֲרֵדִ֖ים בְּמִצְוַ֣ת אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְכַתּוֹרָ֖ה יֵעָשֶֽׂה׃ {פ}
Translated: Now then, let us make a covenant with our God to expel all these women and those who have been born to them, in accordance with the bidding of the Lord and of all who are concerned over the commandment of our God, and let the Teaching be obeyed.
Transliteration: veatah nikherׇt-veriyt leloheynu lehvotsiy khׇl-nashiym vehanvolad mehem vaatsat adonay vehacharediym vemitsevat eloheynu vekhatvorah eiasheh {f}

Hebrew: ק֛וּם כִּֽי־עָלֶ֥יךָ הַדָּבָ֖ר וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ עִמָּ֑ךְ חֲזַ֖ק וַעֲשֵֽׂה׃ {פ}
Translated: Take action, for the responsibility is yours and we are with you. Act with resolve!”
Transliteration: kum khiy-aleykha hadavar vaanachenu imakhe chazak vaasheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם עֶזְרָ֡א וַיַּשְׁבַּ֣ע אֶת־שָׂרֵי֩ הַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים הַלְוִיִּ֜ם וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לַעֲשׂ֛וֹת כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה וַיִּשָּׁבֵֽעוּ׃
Translated: So Ezra at once put the officers of the priests and the Levites and all Israel under oath to act accordingly, and they took the oath.
Transliteration: vayakׇm ezera vayasheva et-sharey hakhohaniym haleviyim vekhׇl-yisherael laashvot khadavar hazeh vayishaveu

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם עֶזְרָ֗א מִלִּפְנֵי֙ בֵּ֣ית הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיֵּ֕לֶךְ אֶל־לִשְׁכַּ֖ת יְהוֹחָנָ֣ן בֶּן־אֶלְיָשִׁ֑יב וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ שָׁ֗ם לֶ֤חֶם לֹֽא־אָכַל֙ וּמַ֣יִם לֹֽא־שָׁתָ֔ה כִּ֥י מִתְאַבֵּ֖ל עַל־מַ֥עַל הַגּוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: Then Ezra rose from his place in front of the House of God and went into the chamber of Jehohanan son of Eliashib; there, he ate no bread and drank no water, for he was in mourning over the trespass of those who had returned from exile.
Transliteration: vayakׇm ezera milifeney veyt haElohimm vayelekhe el-lishekhat yehvochanan ven-eleyashiyv vayelekhe sham lechem lo-akhal umayiim lo-shatah khiy miteavel al-maal hagvolah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבִ֨ירוּ ק֜וֹל בִּיהוּדָ֣ה וִירֽוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם לְכֹל֙ בְּנֵ֣י הַגּוֹלָ֔ה לְהִקָּבֵ֖ץ יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Then a proclamation was issued in Judah and Jerusalem that all who had returned from the exile should assemble in Jerusalem,
Transliteration: vayaaviyru kvol viyhudah viyrushala͏im lekhol veney hagvolah lehikavets yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־יָב֜וֹא לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת הַיָּמִ֗ים כַּעֲצַ֤ת הַשָּׂרִים֙ וְהַזְּקֵנִ֔ים יׇחֳרַ֖ם כׇּל־רְכוּשׁ֑וֹ וְה֥וּא יִבָּדֵ֖ל מִקְּהַ֥ל הַגּוֹלָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and that anyone who did not come in three days would, by decision of the officers and elders, have his property confiscated and himself excluded from the congregation of the returning exiles.
Transliteration: vekhol asher lo-yavvo lisheloshet hayamiym khaatsat hashariym vehazekeniym yׇchoram khׇl-rekhushvo vehu yivadel mikehal hagvolah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּבְצ֣וּ כׇל־אַנְשֵֽׁי־יְהוּדָה֩ וּבִנְיָמִ֨ן ׀ יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת הַיָּמִ֗ים ה֛וּא חֹ֥דֶשׁ הַתְּשִׁיעִ֖י בְּעֶשְׂרִ֣ים בַּחֹ֑דֶשׁ וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ כׇל־הָעָ֗ם בִּרְחוֹב֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים מַרְעִידִ֥ים עַל־הַדָּבָ֖ר וּמֵהַגְּשָׁמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: All the men of Judah and Benjamin assembled in Jerusalem in three days; it was the ninth month, the twentieth of the month. All the people sat in the square of the House of God, trembling on account of the event and because of the rains.
Transliteration: vayikavetsu khׇl-aneshey-yehudah uvineyamin yerushala͏im lisheloshet hayamiym hu chodesh hateshiyiy veesheriym vachodesh vayeshevu khׇl-haam virechvov veyt haElohim mareiydiym al-hadavar umehageshamiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם עֶזְרָ֤א הַכֹּהֵן֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַתֶּ֣ם מְעַלְתֶּ֔ם וַתֹּשִׁ֖יבוּ נָשִׁ֣ים נׇכְרִיּ֑וֹת לְהוֹסִ֖יף עַל־אַשְׁמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Then Ezra the priest got up and said to them, “You have trespassed by bringing home foreign women, thus aggravating the guilt of Israel.
Transliteration: vayakׇm ezera hakhohen vayomer alehem atem mealetem vatoshiyvu nashiym nׇkheriyyvot lehvosiyf al-ashemat yisherael

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה תְּנ֥וּ תוֹדָ֛ה לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם וַעֲשׂ֣וּ רְצוֹנ֑וֹ וְהִבָּֽדְלוּ֙ מֵעַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וּמִן־הַנָּשִׁ֖ים הַנׇּכְרִיּֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: So now, make confession to the L<small>ORD</small>, God of your fathers, and do His will, and separate yourselves from the peoples of the land and from the foreign women.”
Transliteration: veatah tenu tvodah layhovah elohey-avoteykhem vaashu retsvonvo vehivadelu meamey haarets umin-hanashiym hanׇkheriyyvot {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲנ֧וּ כׇֽל־הַקָּהָ֛ל וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ ק֣וֹל גָּד֑וֹל כֵּ֛ן (כדבריך) [כִּדְבָרְךָ֥] עָלֵ֖ינוּ לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translated: The entire congregation responded in a loud voice, “We must surely do just as you say.
Transliteration: vayaanu khׇl-hakahal vayomeru kvol gadvol khen (khdvrykh) [khidevarekha] aleynu laashvot

Hebrew: אֲבָ֞ל הָעָ֥ם רָב֙ וְהָעֵ֣ת גְּשָׁמִ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין כֹּ֖חַ לַעֲמ֣וֹד בַּח֑וּץ וְהַמְּלָאכָ֗ה לֹֽא־לְי֤וֹם אֶחָד֙ וְלֹ֣א לִשְׁנַ֔יִם כִּֽי־הִרְבִּ֥ינוּ לִפְשֹׁ֖עַ בַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: However, many people are involved, and it is the rainy season; it is not possible to remain out in the open, nor is this the work of a day or two, because we have transgressed extensively in this matter.
Transliteration: aval haam rav vehaet geshamiym veeyn khocha laamvod vachuts vehamelakhah lo-leyvom echad velo lishenayiim khiy-hireviynu lifeshoa vadavar hazeh

Hebrew: יַֽעַמְדוּ־נָ֣א שָׂ֠רֵ֠ינוּ לְֽכׇל־הַקָּהָ֞ל וְכֹ֣ל ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בֶּעָרֵ֗ינוּ הַהֹשִׁ֞יב נָשִׁ֤ים נׇכְרִיּוֹת֙ יָבֹא֙ לְעִתִּ֣ים מְזֻמָּנִ֔ים וְעִמָּהֶ֛ם זִקְנֵי־עִ֥יר וָעִ֖יר וְשֹׁפְטֶ֑יהָ עַ֠ד לְהָשִׁ֞יב חֲר֤וֹן אַף־אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ עַ֖ד לַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Let our officers remain on behalf of the entire congregation, and all our townspeople who have brought home foreign women shall appear before them at scheduled times, together with the elders and judges of each town, in order to avert the burning anger of our God from us on this account.”
Transliteration: yaamedu-na shareynu lekhׇl-hakahal vekhol asher veareynu hahoshiyv nashiym nׇkheriyyvot yavo leitiym mezumaniym veimahem zikeney-iyr vaiyr veshofeteyha ad lehashiyv charvon af-eloheynu mimenu ad ladavar hazeh {s}

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ יוֹנָתָ֧ן בֶּן־עֲשָׂהאֵ֛ל וְיַחְזְיָ֥ה בֶן־תִּקְוָ֖ה עָמְד֣וּ עַל־זֹ֑את וּמְשֻׁלָּ֛ם וְשַׁבְּתַ֥י הַלֵּוִ֖י עֲזָרֻֽם׃
Translated: Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah remained for this purpose, assisted by Meshullam and Shabbethai, the Levites.
Transliteration: akhe yvonatan ven-ashahel veyachezeyah ven-tikevah amedu al-zot umeshulam veshavetay haleviy azarum

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵן֮ בְּנֵ֣י הַגּוֹלָה֒ וַיִּבָּדְלוּ֩ עֶזְרָ֨א הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֲנָשִׁ֨ים רָאשֵׁ֧י הָאָב֛וֹת לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָ֖ם וְכֻלָּ֣ם בְּשֵׁמ֑וֹת וַיֵּשְׁב֗וּ בְּי֤וֹם אֶחָד֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִ֔י לְדַרְי֖וֹשׁ הַדָּבָֽר׃
Translated: The returning exiles did so. Ezra the priest and the men who were the chiefs of the ancestral clans—all listed by name—sequestered themselves on the first day of the tenth month to study the matter.
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen veney hagvolah vayivadelu ezera hakhohen anashiym rashey haavvot leveyt avotam vekhulam veshemvot vayeshevu veyvom echad lachodesh haashiyriy ledareyvosh hadavar

Hebrew: וַיְכַלּ֣וּ בַכֹּ֔ל אֲנָשִׁ֕ים הַהֹשִׁ֖יבוּ נָשִׁ֣ים נׇכְרִיּ֑וֹת עַ֛ד י֥וֹם אֶחָ֖ד לַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָרִאשֽׁוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: By the first day of the first month they were done with all the men who had brought home foreign women.
Transliteration: vayekhalu vakhol anashiym hahoshiyvu nashiym nׇkheriyyvot ad yvom echad lachodesh harishvon {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּמָּצֵא֙ מִבְּנֵ֣י הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֹשִׁ֖יבוּ נָשִׁ֣ים נׇכְרִיּ֑וֹת מִבְּנֵ֨י יֵשׁ֤וּעַ בֶּן־יֽוֹצָדָק֙ וְאֶחָ֔יו מַֽעֲשֵׂיָה֙ וֶֽאֱלִיעֶ֔זֶר וְיָרִ֖יב וּגְדַלְיָֽה׃
Translated: Among the priestly families who were found to have brought foreign women were Jeshua son of Jozadak and his brothers Maaseiah, Eliezer, Jarib, and Gedaliah.
Transliteration: vayimatse miveney hakhohaniym asher hoshiyvu nashiym nׇkheriyyvot miveney eishua ven-yvotsadak veechayv maasheyah veeliyezer veyariyv ugedaleyah

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֥וּ יָדָ֖ם לְהוֹצִ֣יא נְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם וַאֲשֵׁמִ֥ים אֵֽיל־צֹ֖אן עַל־אַשְׁמָתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: They gave their word to expel their wives and, acknowledging their guilt, offered a ram from the flock to expiate it.
Transliteration: vayitenu yadam lehvotsiy nesheyhem vaashemiym eyl-tson al-ashematam {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֣י אִמֵּ֔ר חֲנָ֖נִי וּזְבַדְיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Of the sons of Immer: Hanani and Zebadiah;
Transliteration: umiveney imer chananiy uzevadeyah {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֖י חָרִ֑ם מַעֲשֵׂיָ֤ה וְאֵֽלִיָּה֙ וּֽשְׁמַֽעְיָ֔ה וִיחִיאֵ֖ל וְעֻזִּיָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: of the sons of Harim: Maaseiah, Elijah, Shemaiah, Jehiel, and Uzziah;
Transliteration: umiveney charim maasheyah veeliyah ushemaeyah viychiyel veuziyah {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֖י פַּשְׁח֑וּר אֶלְיוֹעֵינַ֤י מַֽעֲשֵׂיָה֙ יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל נְתַנְאֵ֔ל יוֹזָבָ֖ד וְאֶלְעָשָֽׂה׃ {ס}
Translated: of the sons of Pashhur: Elioenai, Maaseiah, Ishmael, Nethanel, Jozabad, and Elasah;
Transliteration: umiveney fashechur eleyvoeynay maasheyah yishemael netaneel yvozavad veeleashah {s}

Hebrew: וּמִֽן־הַלְוִיִּ֑ם יוֹזָבָ֣ד וְשִׁמְעִ֗י וְקֵֽלָיָה֙ ה֣וּא קְלִיטָ֔א פְּתַֽחְיָ֥ה יְהוּדָ֖ה וֶאֱלִיעֶֽזֶר׃ {ס}
Translated: of the Levites: Jozabad, Shimei, Kelaiah who is Kelita, Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer.
Transliteration: umin-haleviyim yvozavad veshimeiy vekelayah hu keliyta fetacheyah yehudah veeliyezer {s}

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַמְשֹׁרְרִ֖ים אֶלְיָשִׁ֑יב וּמִן־הַשֹּׁ֣עֲרִ֔ים שַׁלֻּ֥ם וָטֶ֖לֶם וְאוּרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Of the singers: Eliashib. Of the gatekeepers: Shallum, Telem, and Uri.
Transliteration: umin-hameshoreriym eleyashiyv umin-hashoariym shalum vatelem veuriy {s}

Hebrew: וּמִֽיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִבְּנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֡שׁ רַ֠מְיָ֠ה וְיִזִּיָּ֤ה וּמַלְכִּיָּה֙ וּמִיָּמִ֣ן וְאֶלְעָזָ֔ר וּמַלְכִּיָּ֖ה וּבְנָיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Of the Israelites: of the sons of Parosh: Ramiah, Izziah, Malchijah, Mijamin, Eleazar, Malchijah, and Benaiah;
Transliteration: umiyisherael miveney fareosh rameyah veyiziyah umalekhiyah umiyamin veeleazar umalekhiyah uvenayah {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֖י עֵילָ֑ם מַתַּנְיָ֤ה זְכַרְיָה֙ וִיחִיאֵ֣ל וְעַבְדִּ֔י וִירֵמ֖וֹת וְאֵלִיָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: of the sons of Elam: Mattaniah, Zechariah, Jehiel, Abdi, Jeremoth, and Elijah;
Transliteration: umiveney eylam mataneyah zekhareyah viychiyel veavediy viyremvot veeliyah {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֖י זַתּ֑וּא אֶלְיוֹעֵנַ֤י אֶלְיָשִׁיב֙ מַתַּנְיָ֣ה וִֽירֵמ֔וֹת וְזָבָ֖ד וַעֲזִיזָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: of the sons of Zattu: Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah, Jeremoth, Zabad, and Aziza;
Transliteration: umiveney zatu eleyvoenay eleyashiyv mataneyah viyremvot vezavad vaaziyza {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֖י בֵּבָ֑י יְהוֹחָנָ֥ן חֲנַנְיָ֖ה זַבַּ֥י עַתְלָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: of the sons of Bebai: Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, and Athlai;
Transliteration: umiveney vevay yehvochanan chananeyah zavay atelay {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֖י בָּנִ֑י מְשֻׁלָּ֤ם מַלּוּךְ֙ וַעֲדָיָ֔ה יָשׁ֖וּב וּשְׁאָ֥ל (ירמות) [וְרָמֽוֹת]׃ {ס}
Translated: of the sons of Bani: Meshullam, Malluch, Adaiah, Jashub, Sheal, and Ramoth;
Transliteration: umiveney vaniy meshulam malukhe vaadayah yashuv usheal (yrmvt) [veramvot] {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֛י פַּחַ֥ת מוֹאָ֖ב עַדְנָ֣א וּכְלָ֑ל בְּנָיָ֤ה מַעֲשֵׂיָה֙ מַתַּנְיָ֣ה בְצַלְאֵ֔ל וּבִנּ֖וּי וּמְנַשֶּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: of the sons of Pahath-moab: Adna, Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezalel, Binnui, and Manasseh;
Transliteration: umiveney fachat mvoav adena ukhelal venayah maasheyah mataneyah vetsaleel uvinuy umenasheh {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י חָרִ֑ם אֱלִיעֶ֧זֶר יִשִּׁיָּ֛ה מַלְכִּיָּ֖ה שְׁמַֽעְיָ֥ה שִׁמְעֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: of the sons of Harim: Eliezer, Isshijah, Malchijah, Shemaiah, and Shimeon;
Transliteration: uveney charim eliyezer yishiyah malekhiyah shemaeyah shimevon {s}

Hebrew: בִּנְיָמִ֥ן מַלּ֖וּךְ שְׁמַרְיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: also Benjamin, Malluch, and Shemariah;
Transliteration: vineyamin malukhe shemareyah {s}

Hebrew: מִבְּנֵ֖י חָשֻׁ֑ם מַתְּנַ֤י מַתַּתָּה֙ זָבָ֣ד אֱלִיפֶ֔לֶט יְרֵמַ֥י מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה שִׁמְעִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: of the sons of Hashum: Mattenai, Mattattah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, and Shimei;
Transliteration: miveney chashum matenay matatah zavad eliyfelet yeremay menasheh shimeiy {s}

Hebrew: מִבְּנֵ֣י בָנִ֔י מַעֲדַ֥י עַמְרָ֖ם וְאוּאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: of the sons of Bani: Maadai, Amram, and Uel;
Transliteration: miveney vaniy maaday ameram veuel {s}

Hebrew: בְּנָיָ֥ה בֵדְיָ֖ה (כלוהי) [כְּלֽוּהוּ]׃ {ס}
Translated: also Benaiah, Bedeiah, Cheluhu,
Transliteration: venayah vedeyah (khlvhy) [kheluhu] {s}

Hebrew: וַנְיָ֥ה מְרֵמ֖וֹת אֶלְיָשִֽׁיב׃ {ס}
Translated: Vaniah, Meremoth, Eliashib,
Transliteration: vaneyah meremvot eleyashiyv {s}

Hebrew: מַתַּנְיָ֥ה מַתְּנַ֖י (ויעשו) [וְיַעֲשָֽׂי]׃ {ס}
Translated: Mattaniah, Mattenai, Jaasai,
Transliteration: mataneyah matenay (vyshv) [veyaashay] {s}
